title: Selling District Sales Manager
description:
Since 1911, State Industrial Products has helped customers "Care for Work Environments"®. Throughout the years, our main focus has been to help customers enhance building environments and improve equipment productivity. No matter where you go in the United States, Canada or Puerto Rico, you will find State products hard at work in every industry imaginable. From market leading drain maintenance and air care programs to innovative cleaning systems, maintenance supplies and auxiliary programs, State Industrial Products offers facility management benefits that are second to none. We’re a thriving company, and we’re looking for driven individuals to join our team. That’s where you come in!

WHAT’S IN IT FOR ME

We have a dedicated crew of more than 700+ innovative and dedicated employees. Here are a few reasons why we’d make a great team:
• Earn more. With a guaranteed base pay plus monthly bonus.
• Career Opportunity. We are a high growth company with excellent opportunities for advancement. Our training and development programs prepare you for growth and advancement.
• Work-life balance. We work a typical Monday-Friday 8a-5p work day. Take a well-deserved break on us, and enjoy time with your family and friends with generous PTO.
• Benefits and Perks. We offer competitive pay, as well as an excellent benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401(k) matching up to 3%, long term disability, and tuition assistance.

Position Summary:
The Selling District Sales Manager is responsible for developing and maintaining a sales territory, while learning State Chemical's sales process. Responsible for learning the sales process and product knowledge, using company training tools. During this period the Selling DSM will learn account development and territory planning. Once the Selling DSM meets agreed upon goals for new territory growth, you will be responsible to hire an account manager to take over the new territory while assuming the full role of District Sales Manager. The Selling District Sales Manager will report to the Regional Sales Manager.

Position Responsibilities:
• Meet/exceed sales growth targets through continuous growth in average order value, new agreement growth and average orders per month.
• Staff the sales organization with the right people.
• Field supervision and development of new and veteran sales associates.
• Establish clear district goals and sales targets through business and territory planning.
• Reinforce and support corporate policies and guidelines in a consistent, professional company manner.
• Maintain/build sales relationships with existing and new customers.
• Aid in the development of future Sales Managers through training assignments.
• Act as a liaison between field sales and company headquarters.
• Complete paperwork necessary to fulfill position responsibilities.
• Promote company marketing and promotional programs.

ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS:
• Bachelor degree in related field
• Sales experience
• Train and coach direct sales representatives during the selling process, and in planning process.
• Territory and district management.
• Interviewing skills for sales positions and with customers.
• Selling and coaching skills, problem solving.
• Ability to participate in group projects or activities that can result in new ideas that generate or enhance short-term results.
• Manage multiple tasks at any one time.
• Effective communication skills at all levels of the organization both verbal and written.
• Source, recruit future sales candidates.

EOE Statement: State Industrial Products is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, gender, age, veteran status, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status or disability (in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act*), or any other legally protected status, with respect to employment opportunities.

ADA Disclosure: Any candidate who feels that they may need an accommodation to complete this application, or any portions of same, based on the impact of a disability should contact our Human Resources Department. #LI-CF1 #ZR

title: Group Sales Manager - Quebec Market
description:
Position: Group Sales Manager - Quebec Market

Workplace: 1050 Rue De La Gauchetière W, Montreal, QC H3B 4C9

Status : Full time

Salary: Starting at $75,000 per year

Acquired in 2018 by Tidan, this hotel is located in the heart of the Montreal metropolis. The Marriott Château Champlain is a 1-minute walk from the metro, accessible via an underground walkway adjacent to the Bell Centre. This iconic Montreal hotel was completely renovated in 2021, with 36 floors, 614 rooms, 13 suites, 25 meeting rooms and can accommodate up to 1,000 guests. If you're looking for a stylish, modern working environment, join the inspiring team at one of downtown Montreal's leading hotels.

Reporting to the Director, Sales & Marketing, as a member of the Sales & Marketing team, the Manager is responsible for maximizing revenues generated in the group segment. He/she will be responsible for handling requests from groups of 50 rooms or more from all segments in Quebec. He/she will work closely with other managers to maximize sales and liaise with convention and meeting service managers.

Primary Responsibilities:
• Develop and maintain key business relationships and partnerships to increase company rates, volume and revenue.
• Negotiate group rates.
• Develop and generate group contracts.
• Follow-up on proposals and contracts.
• Strategically structure pricing for each category segment.
• Understand global market and economic trends.
• Work in collaboration with Marriott International (GSO) and business partners.
• Participate in industry activities both inside and outside the hotel.

Qualifications and Skills Required:
• Very strong written and oral communication skills
• Professional attitude and behavior (teamwork skills, autonomy, dynamism, interpersonal skills, honesty, versatility, initiative, organizational skills).
• Good customer service skills.
• Good interpersonal skills
• Attention to detail and quality.
• Good judgment and decision-making skills.
• Planning and organization.
• Ethics and integrity.
• Creativity and innovation in service delivery.

Languages: Bilingualism (French and English), both spoken and written, is required for this position, as we serve an international clientele.

Experience
• 1-year sales experience is preferred
• Strong sales, negotiation, presentation and business writing skills.
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
• Ability to meet deadlines in a demanding environment.
• Willingness to travel and availability evenings and weekends as needed.

Benefits
• Group insurance, upon hiring
• RRSPS
• Reduced rates
• Open to work from home in combination with on-site work
• 3 weeks vacation

Who we are:

Tidan is a hotel and real estate group in business for 52 years with a portfolio of 12 hotels and over 65 real estate properties, as well as the largest tennis club across North America. To find out more about Tidan, visit https://www.tidan.com/fr/.

Why join our team:

In addition to competitive salaries, we offer employee benefits, such as group insurance consisting of life insurance, disability insurance, medical and dental insurance, as well as vision care. Our employees have 24/7 virtual access to healthcare professionals via the Employee Assistance Program. Personal days and vacations are scheduled according to the department and hotel you join. A bonus is also provided via our referral program, and much more.

We believe in teamwork and are committed to creating a high-performance team, whether through training or solidifying team relationships. We admire our employees for taking on professional challenges, and we support them in their achievement. Take the plunge and join the Tidan team through our wide range of employment opportunities. Whether in the hotel or real estate industry, there's a place for you.

title: Sales Manager (HOSPITALITY/ HOME), Montreal
description:
Our Company

Technogym inspires 55 million daily users to train using our innovative & engaging solutions for fitness, sport and health. By promoting the wellness lifestyle of exercise, a balanced diet, and a positive mental approach, Technogym has rapidly grown into a success story of over 2,500 employees at 15 branches, expanding to more than 100 countries and has been selected as Official Supplier to 9 editions of the Olympic Games - from Sydney 2000 to Paris 2024.

If you are a team player with strong relationship skills and an international approach, eager to invest your energy in building dreams, you have the right spirit to join Technogym! You will naturally fit with our culture if you work out and live a healthy lifestyle, are pro-active, determined and digital savvy. Move with us for a better world!

Your Role

We are looking for an experienced, results-driven, customer-oriented Sales Manager. In this role, you will be in charge of developing and implementing an effective, sustainable local sales strategy.

You will be responsible for planning and executing sales in the own sales segment and will be a critical member of the local leadership team.

As a Technogym salesperson, you should be hungry, highly professional, industry credible and collaborative. You will develop and maintain strong relationships and manage a large portfolio of products, services and solutions.

If you would like to work for a business leading the way in Wellness, with an immersive ethos and vision, incredibly passionate people, and products and solutions you can truly buy in to, then look no further!

Your Impact
• Achieve sales targets in line with reserved conditions and DSO targets (Cash In)
• Contribute to defining and implementing the local Marketing Plan
• Hire, train and coach the Sales team, to ensure the right level of skills and competencies on products, processes and systems, building a comprehensive sales organization in line with the market potential of the own segment
• Execute weekly pipeline management reviews to maximize conversion rates and provide a reliable forecast
• Guarantee the systematic use of the CRM to obtain a clean, up-to-date and complete database in terms of marketing attributes, clusters, leads, etc.
• Develop and create top locations to build an aspirational brand and generate home leads
• Lead the Sales team by maximizing performance, people development and engagement according to the Company Culture model
• Guarantee continuous, proactive feedback from the market

About You

Ideally, you are passionate about working out, enthusiastic and proactive, while also down-to-earth and ethical. You should be a leader with strong organizational and analytical skills, curious, with no fear of crossing borders. You can innovate and find new business, leveraging strong strategic competencies

What you should bring:
• 3/5+ years’ experience in a similar role
• Master’s Degree
• Fluency in English
• Experience in sales network management and organization
• Experience in CRM management
• Consultative selling approach, knowledge of sales techniques, communication and presentation skills
• Strong leadership which inspires your coworkers and customers with a high degree of empathy

Technogym is an Equal Opportunities Employer

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, sex, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief.

Discover your potential with a career at Technogym, where work means loving what you do, taking on challenges, learning from others, sharing a vision and making it come true

title: Project Sales Manager
description:
Sales Manager, Capital – Eastern Canada (Montreal) Build a better world Working with us, you are a part of delivering minerals needed for global economic growth. It is

a big responsibility, and we commit ourselves to minimize environmental impact while

increasing productivity. To achieve this, your skills, your curiosity, and your drive for

change are important. Together, we create a collaborative and safe workplace and contribute

to producing the materials needed for a better future. Joining a team of more than 9,000 people working across more than 60 countries, you will be part

of an agile network of talented and ambitious people. In fact, we count on you to engage,

connect, and collaborate with colleagues all over the world. Seize the opportunity to learn,

create and develop your potential with us. FLS has an exciting growth opportunity for an experienced Sales Manager to join our team,

driving the execution of sales strategy for capital mining projects and products within our

North American region (US, Canada, Mexico, Central America Caribbean). The position will be

based in Montreal and will require up to 50% travel. FLS’s Capital Sales team is primarily focused on transacting FLS mineral processing and mine shaft systems solutions into greenfield projects and brownfield expansion projects at operations. To be effective the successful candidate will: - be active in a business development capacity in the region and establish/maintain an effective network - provide local account management in key client headquarters regional offices - have proven prior experience and relationships with the EPCM offices in the region - understand the breadth of product and service offerings and understand how to engage the appropriate FLSmidth resources to present the strongest technical offering and other key value propositions to solve client challenges - stay up to date on mining news relevant to the region, ensure FLS is visible within the designated regional area, and identify qualified opportunities - assist in the development, own and lead the implementation of strategy for project pursuits - maintain an appropriate and qualified pipeline of opportunities in the FLS CRM platform - travel to conferences, attend/host industry events, and visit customers to best understand opportunities and position FLSmidth solutions and value propositions - Manage complex proposal preparation, review, and submission through order negotiation/customer acceptance, and sales to execution handover meetings What you bring: - Degree/certification in Business, Mineral Processing, Extractive Metallurgy, Mechanical or Chemical Engineering - Possess a deep understanding of how mining projects are permitted, developed, financed and executed - 5+ years of demonstrated successful years in sales and/or project delivery in the Mining industry. - Experience in effectively interfacing with clients and gaining credibility; developing and implementing project-specific sales strategies. - Strong communication skills, both written and verbal (English and French proficiency is a requirement) - Respect deadlines and works independently to reach them. - Possess proficient skills within the Microsoft Office environment, specifically Outlook, Excel, Word, Teams, and PowerPoint. What we offer - An equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace - A global network of supportive colleagues and growth opportunities - Work-life balance so you can focus on professional and personal priorities - Competitive benefit package and retirement preparation - Time to recharge through vacation time and holidays Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted through email. FLS is the leading supplier of engineering, equipment and service solutions to customers in

the mining industry – for more information please visit FLSmidth.com/careers

title: Marketing Manager | B2B | Established SaaS Start-up | Hybrid (Montreal) | $100k + Bonus (5%) + Equity
description:
Marketing Manager | B2B | Established SaaS Start-up | Hybrid (Montreal) | $100k + Bonus (5%) + Equity

The Company

Our client is a forward-thinking established startup transforming decision-making in the real estate sector. By leveraging advanced data science, they simplify urban complexities to deliver actionable insights for individuals, investors, and organizations. Their proprietary platform, powered by an extensive dataset, enables smarter decisions in everything from property investments to urban planning. Recently securing Series B funding, the company is poised for rapid growth, driving innovation and sustainability in cities across North America.

The Role

As the Marketing Manager, you’ll take a hands-on approach to developing and executing marketing strategies that drive revenue growth and customer acquisition. Working closely with the VP of Marketing and the Content Manager, you’ll lead integrated campaigns, create impactful content, and collaborate with sales and business development teams to deliver highly qualified leads. This hybrid role, based in Montreal, offers the flexibility to work remotely on Mondays and Fridays, with office days from Tuesday to Thursday. With a competitive package and equity on the table, this is a unique opportunity to thrive in a fast-paced, mission-driven environment.

The Responsibilities
• Campaign Development & Execution: Collaborate with the sales and business development teams to design and implement integrated campaigns that align with revenue goals and generate qualified leads.
• Content Creation & Dissemination: Develop and distribute compelling content across multiple channels, including email, social media, and paid advertising, ensuring maximum audience engagement.
• Agency Collaboration: Build and maintain productive relationships with external marketing agencies to ensure high-quality execution of campaigns and initiatives.
• Marketing Automation & Paid Media: Manage marketing automation workflows, optimize email campaigns, and oversee paid media efforts on platforms such as LinkedIn, Google Ads, and Meta.
• Strategic Alignment: Ensure marketing initiatives directly contribute to business objectives by closely collaborating with the sales and business development teams.
• Visual Design & Tools: At least a basic understanding of Figma and Adobe Creative Suite with an eye for design.
• Experimentation & Growth: Stay curious and proactive, experimenting with new tools and strategies to keep marketing efforts fresh and effective.

The Requirements
• 3–5 years of B2B marketing experience, preferably in SaaS or a startup environment. Experience managing agency relationships is a strong advantage.
• Familiarity with marketing automation tools, email platforms (e.g., Salesforce), and paid media platforms like LinkedIn Ads and Google Ads.
• Proven ability to create compelling written and visual content, with at least basic proficiency in tools such as Figma and Adobe Creative Suite.
• Deep understanding of how marketing drives revenue growth, with a focus on creating measurable impact.
• Strong ability to work cross-functionally with sales, business development, and external agencies.
• Exposure to the real-estate industry is ideal, but not required.
• An MBA will be highly regarded.
• Fluency in English is required; bilingual proficiency in French is a plus.

The Benefits
• Competitive Compensation: $100,000 base salary, 5% performance bonus, and equity options.
• Flexible Work Model: A hybrid setup offering in-office collaboration from Tuesday to Thursday and remote work on Mondays and Fridays.
• Growth Potential: Join a fast-scaling company at a pivotal stage, with significant opportunities for career advancement.
• Innovative Environment: Thrive in a startup culture that values experimentation, creativity, and professional development.

If you’re a versatile and results-driven marketing professional with a passion for collaboration and innovation, this is your opportunity to make a meaningful impact. Take on a key role in shaping the future of a growing company while working at the intersection of technology, real estate, and sustainability. Apply today to embark on an exciting new chapter in your career! To automatically receive notifications upon new roles and market updates, follow our LinkedIn page: https://www.linkedin.com/company/white-bay-search/

title: Entry Level Corporate Sales Executive
description:
Are you tenacious, passionate, driven, confident and hungry to succeed? ME Events Group conferences offer a global perspective on all major business sectors including: Defense, Pharma/Life Sciences, Finance, Capital Markets, Energy & Utilities, Oil & Gas, Legal and Manufacturing. We are currently looking to recruit a number of entry-level sales positions within our North American Conferences business based in downtown Montreal.

We are looking for hungry, ambitious, entrepreneurial salespeople that are looking for a challenge and posess a desire to learn and progress. Successful candidates will receive comprehensive training and the opportunity to progress within this fast growing international company. We Deliver: Comprehensive sales training and continued development Open, competitive and vibrant sales environment Uncapped commission structure allowing top sales executives to excel Career development opportunities both internally and internationally If this career opportunity with ME Events Group interests you, and you are CURRENTLY located in (or have IMMEDIATE plans to relocate to) Montreal, then we strongly encourage you to submit your resume, in English, to alexg@marcusevansmo.com For further information on marcus evans, please visit us online at: www.me-eventsgroup.com Desired Skills and Experience In addition to the above you will possess: The confidence to sell our events over the phone to C-Level Executives within Fortune 500 companies Excellent Research skills able to cope with changing product cycles and target markets Tenacious and Persistent approach to overcoming obstacles A Team player, contributing to the overall success of each event team.

Self-Motivated with a desire to develop a career in sales and progress within the organization. Benefits include: A robust compensation package based upon results. Comprehensive initial, as well as ongoing sales training programs.

Fast-track internal promotion opportunities into a management role based upon performance. Full health benefits (medical, dental) International sales opportunities. The opportunity for you to attend some of North America's most prestigious business conference events held at premiere, five star locations.

About this company marcus evans is an international business events and information company with five main principle areas of business activity * Business Events: providing valuable and niche focused industry insights to delegates worldwide and bringing B2B buyers and sellers together at over 2000 conferences, summits & congresses annually. * Business Training: training programmes in a variety of formats including Professional Training, Financial Training, Language Training and Industry Sector Training. * Corporate Hospitality: providing first class hospitality to Fortune 500 companies at the world's leading sports and cultural events.
• Business Information & Market Research: providing in depth analysis through subscription research products and publications *Sports & Entertainment: The group's involvement in Sports & Entertainment includes, in the sports world the ownership of Ipswich Town Football Club & in entertainment Ken McReddie Associates, a long established and leading theatrical agency representing artists in the fields of Film, TV & Theatre.

title: Responsable des ventes - Remote Product Sales Manager
description:
We are actively seeking a Senior Product and Sales Manager on behalf of our international client, a global leader specialized in the manufacturing of high technology systems : vacuum furnaces and heat treatment, crystal growth and plasma systems for multiple industries such as semiconductor, hard metals, electronics, optics, energy, among others. This position will be responsible for leading strategic sales activities for the development of vacuum furnace systems in several sectors.

100% remote (Ontario area/East Canada)

Develop new sales opportunities for Industrial Furnace with strategic customer accounts.
• Develop and manage the Canadian Industrial Furnace sales, operating budgets and forecast, within corporate guidelines, ensuring positive EBIT.
• Travel to locations throughout Canada and present product offerings and collect external customers’ and engineer’s requirements and viewpoints to senior management.
• Attend trade shows lectures at technical conferences and present the companies technology to the Canadian Market place
• Execute a Strategic Development Program in conjunction with the client which extends our product line offering into the Canadian Markets.
• May assist in developing a local contract service operations center, establish local supply chain and or full manufacturing capability, while ensuring the regional requirements reflect current and projected needs.
• Develop complete understanding of the equipment, modifications and current offerings and produce and present sales materials to effect positive development of the Industrial Market.
• Assist in the formulation, documentation and implementation of ISO compliant organizational safety standards technical service bulletins, best operating practices (BOP), product safety notifications (PSN), as well as best known methods (BKM)

Minimum of BS in Mechanical Engineering or Material Sciences. MBA or PhD is highly desirable.
• 7-10 years of experience in Project or Product Management, Manufacturing or Sales and Marketing (ideally sales of heattreatment, diffusion bonding, vacuum brazing furnaces for metallurgical processes or chemical vapor deposition & infiltration (CVD/CVI).
• Basic contacts to industrial manufacturing companies
• Experience, at least basic knowledge in materials technology and or contract services
• Experience in Value Analysis and Engineering, desirable
• Advanced or Native in English, French and German will be seen as a plus
• Must have valid passport & driver’s license and be willing to travel more than 50% as standard routine.

Demonstrates excellent leadership qualities
• Ability to analyze complex business operations information and data, compile and present management reports, presentations ,and effectively respond to questions from suppliers, customers, and other interested parties regarding same.
• Familiarity with Miller Heiman Sales methodology would be advantageous.
• Basic understanding of CRM sales tools.

title: Medical Territory Sales Manager
description:
Pharmaceutical and medical

Our client, a worldwide medical company recognized for their high-quality medical devices for endovascular interventions, is currently looking for a talented sales representative to cover the territory of Montreal and the western area of the province of Québec.

The territory manager is responsible for achieving sales goals. You are the best talent for this opportunity if you have experience selling medical devices in Cat Lab and enjoy performing product trials during endovascular procedures.

Bac or nursing degree with sales experience
• Min 3 years of experience in operating room sales or intervention (Cat Lab) is mandatory
• Flexible, open for travelling including occasional overnight stays

title: Sales Executive
description:
Additional Information
Job Number24200274
Job CategorySales & Marketing
LocationW Montreal, 901 Square Victoria, Montreal, QC, Canada, H2Z 1R1
ScheduleFull Time
Located Remotely?N
Position Type Management

JOB SUMMARY

Handles customer inquires and acts as the on-property liaison for group sales within the pre-defined peak room parameters for Property Sales. Contracts and closes group business in addition to conducting site inspections. Verifies business is turned over properly and in a timely fashion for quality service delivery. Achieves group revenue goals by actively up-selling each business opportunity to maximize revenue opportunity. Implements the brand’s service strategy and applicable brand initiatives in all aspects of the sales process and drives customer loyalty by delivering service excellence throughout each customer experience.

CANDIDATE PROFILE

Education and Experience

Required:
• High school diploma or GED; 4 years experience in the sales and marketing, guest services, front desk, or related professional area.

OR
• 2-year degree from an accredited university in Business Administration, Marketing, Hotel and Restaurant Management, or related major; 2 years experience in the sales and marketing or related professional area.

Preferred:
• Large group sales experience.

CORE WORK ACTIVITIES

Managing Sales Activities
• Handles customer inquiries and acts as the on-property liaison for group sales within the pre-defined peak room parameters for Property sales.
• Achieves group revenue goals by responding to incoming group/catering opportunities for the property that are within the pre-defined peak room parameters.
• Understands the overall market (e.g., competitors’ strengths and weaknesses, economic trends, supply and demand etc.) and knows how to sell against them.
• Closes the best opportunities for the property based on market conditions and property needs.
• Uses negotiating skills and creative selling abilities to close on business and negotiate contracts.
• Achieves group revenue goals by actively up-selling each business opportunity to maximize revenue opportunity.
• Partners with the sales team to identify new group/catering business and achieve personal and property revenue goals.
• Acts as the on-property liaison for group events over the Group Sales peak room parameters of the Sales Office.
• Develops group sales revenue and operation budgets, and provides forecasting reports.
• Works with the management team to create and implement a group sales/marketing plan addressing revenue, customers, and market.
• Assists with selling, implementation, and follow-through of group sales promotions.
• Attends pre- and post-convention meetings to understand group needs, obtain feedback on quality of product (e.g., rooms, meeting facilities and equipment, food and beverage), service levels, and overall satisfaction.
• Provides accurate, complete, and effective turnover to Event Management.
• Executes and supports Marriott’s Customer Service Standards and hotel’s Brand Standards.
• Conducts site inspections, as required.
• Monitors same day selling procedures to maximize room revenue and control hotel occupancy.
• Executes and supports the operational aspects of business booked (e.g., generating proposal, writing contract, customer correspondence).
• Participates in and practices daily service basics of the brand
• Verifies that the property implements a seamless turnover from sales to operations and back to sales while consistently delivering high level of service.
• Monitors the effective resolution of guest issues that arise as a result of the sales process by creating mechanisms to channel issues to property leadership and/or other appropriate stakeholders.
• Performs other duties, as assigned, to meet business needs.

Building Successful Relationships
• Develops relationship with existing and new customers to enable future bookings through sales calls, entertainment, FAM trips, trade shows, etc.
• Develops relationships within the community to strengthen and expand customer base for group/catering sales opportunities.
• Partners with Event Management and/or Operations in providing a customer experience that exceeds the customer’s expectations.
• Executes exemplary customer service to drive customer satisfaction and loyalty by assisting the customer and verifying their satisfaction before and during their program/event.
• Implements the brand’s service strategy and applicable brand initiatives in all aspects of the sales process and drives customer loyalty by delivering service excellence throughout each customer experience.
• Serves the customer by understanding their needs and recommending the appropriate features and services that best meet their needs and exceed their expectations, while building a relationship and loyalty to Marriott.
• Gains understanding of the property’s primary target customer and service expectations; serves the customer by understanding their business, business issues and concerns, to offer better business solution both prior to, and during, the program/event.

The salary range for this position is $62,000 to $79,000 annually.

Marriott International is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive, people-first culture. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, such as disability and veteran status, or any other basis covered under applicable law.

Notification to Applicants: W Montreal takes seriously its obligations under the applicable provincial legislation and will provide accommodations to job applicants needing assistance. If you require an accommodation in relation to this job posting, our online application or an interview, please call 905-366-5227 or email CanadaApplicationAccommodation@marriott.com and a member of our Human Resources team will respond to your request. Please note that this phone number and email are only for those individuals who would like to request an accessibility accommodation as part of the recruiting process.

W Hotels’ mission is to Ignite Curiosity, Expand Worlds. We are a place to experience life. We’re here to open doors and open minds. We are constantly inspired by new faces and new experiences. A tuned-in, up-for-anything spirit is at our core and has made us renowned for reinventing the norms of luxury around the globe. Whatever/Whenever is our culture and service philosophy that brings our guests’ passions to life. If you are original, innovative, and always looking towards the future of what’s possible, welcome to W Hotels. In joining W Hotels, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International. Be where you can do your best work, begin your purpose, belong to an amazing global team, and become the best version of you.

title: Product Manager
description:
Product Manager
At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions.
Write the next chapter of your ABB story.

This is a position with grade

12
This position reports to

Business Manager - EML North America
Your role and responsibilities

Working as a Product Manager, you will be a key member of the NAM product management team responsible to drive profitable growth of our core Emergency Lighting (EML) self-contained product portfolio, defining product roadmaps, marketing plans, including marketing communication, training, and sales initiatives.

Reporting to the NAM EML Product Line Manager, you will be responsible for driving the life cycle of products, systems, or services, including development, launch, maintenance, pricing and profitability of EML Self-contained product portfolio in North America.

This position is contributing to the Electrification, Smart Buildings division and is located in Dorval, Quebec.

Responsibilities:
• Driving the profitability and life cycle of EML Self-contained product portfolio by defining pricing guidelines and market position
• Overseeing inventory levels and sales volumes to ensure ability to meet customer orders, while tracking and analyzing the performance and trends of the EML Self-contained product portfolio
• Working closely with R&D to propose and evaluate product feasibility projects and roadmaps for new Emergency Lighting products
• Monitoring revenues and sales trends and communicate with cross-functional manufacturing team, forecasted fluctuations providing the ability to meet customer needs, while ensuring profitable levels of inventory
• Ensuring set KPIs are reached on the life cycle of Emergency Lighting products and services
• Structuring pricing guidelines & market positioning to optimize organic growth and expand into new segments
• Providing technical and commercial assistance to the sales teams
Qualifications for the role
• More than 8 years of experience in a similar function, with strong technology background and a good understanding of the electrical construction/lighting industry
• Sound knowledge of lighting products
• Demonstrated experience of managing product, marketing, and sales strategy
• Knowledge and experience of related products and solutions development in an agile organization
• A collaborative, solution-focused approach, with strong communication and relationship-building skills
• A bachelor’s degree of engineering, or equivalent experience
• French and English bilingualism, spoken and written. French is required. English is necessary to communicate with clients outside of Quebec.

Benefits
• Retirement plan
• Accident insurance
• Healthcare plan
• Wellbeing program
More about us
• ***Referral bonus premium $1,500.00**** 

Emergency Lighting Business is a global leader in the design, manufacture and marketing of specialized lighting solutions for emergency situations and extreme environments. Our pride lies in the creation of innovative products and services, enhancing the safety of buildings and offering people peace of mind.

We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.

For the ninth consecutive year, ABB Canada has been recognized as one of Canada's Best Employers by Forbes magazine. Consistently ranked as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers, Montreal's Best Employers, Canada's Best Employers for Young People, Canada's Greenest Employers and a long-time recipient of the Women in Governance Parity Certification, ABB's culture and commitment is to provide a caring workplace where everyone collaborates, feels valued, respected, included and supported. Also committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to the applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.

ABB's Military Reservist Policy offers Canada's Reserve Force members the flexibility to undergo military training and activities while maintaining job security, seniority, pay, benefits, and privileges as ABB employees, including up to 15 paid working days per year for training, as well as extended leave for operations both in Canada and abroad, ensuring seamless career integration with our nation's defense forces.

title: Directeur - Ventes "Fils et câbles " / Manager – Sales "Wires and cables"
description:
As a Manager – Sales, you will provide strategic direction and progressive leadership to achieve sales and profit goals within a region, specific line(s) of business or channels. You will design and recommend sales and marketing programs and set short and long-term sales strategies. You will manage a single location with a total sales revenue of up to $50 million and manage a team of direct reports.

Responsibilities:
• Develops and administers sales plans to ensure customer satisfaction, assigned quota attainment, good reference accounts, and highly skilled and motivated staff.
• Partners with Marketing to develop and implement sales marketing programs and initiatives.
• Determines annual sales and gross profit plan by implementing marketing strategies and analyzing trends and results.
• Establishes sales objectives by forecasting and developing sales quota for territories.
• Projects expected sales volume and profit for existing and new product lines and customers.
• Maintains sales volume, product mix and selling price by keeping current with market supply and demand, changing trends, economic indicators and competitors.
• Coordinates order service by directing account representatives and executives on quotations, proposals, project order management techniques, and customer complaint resolution.
• Establishes and adjusts billing margin by monitoring costs, competition and market conditions and negotiating cost side levels.
• Manages sales staff by recruiting, selecting, orienting and training employees.
• Maintains sales staff results by coaching employees, planning, monitoring and appraising job results.
• Develops and maintains relationships with top customers.
• Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing professional publications and participating in professional societies.
• Forecasts and communicates intricate details to senior business managers.
• interfaces with internal support departments to establish positive customer experience.
• Partners with suppliers to maintain customer relationships, provides training to staff, and executes marketing programs and initiatives.
• Partners with various internal departments to troubleshoot issues such as inventory and operations

Qualifications:
• High School Degree or Equivalent required; Bachelor’s Degree - Sales, Business Administration, Engineering, or relevant field preferred
• Prior professional sales experience in related industry/3+ years
• Prior experience with managing a sales team or sales programs/1+ year
• Working knowledge of business and management principles in strategic planning, resource allocation and coordination of people and resources
• Demonstrated verbal, written, analytical, persuasion and interpersonal skills
• Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer and personal services, including customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction
• Ability to exercise teamwork, leadership, and flexibility
• Excellent time management and computer skills
• 5 years related industry professional sales
• 2 years managing staff and programs at national, district or regional level
• Ability to travel up to 25%

Working Environment: Outside Sales – Work is generally performed in an office environment, but employee may need to travel to customer sites or warehouse facilities. Driving may be required for an extended period of time with frequent stops and starts. Can be exposed to outdoor weather conditions.

Wesco International, Inc., including its subsidiaries and affiliates (“Wesco”) provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, religion, color, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, or other characteristics protected by law. US applicants only, we are an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer.

Chez Wesco, nous construisons, connectons, alimentons et protégeons le monde. En tant que prestataire de premier plan dans la distribution, les services logistiques et les solutions de chaîne d’approvisionnement B2B, nous créons un monde sur lequel vous pouvez compter.

Le plus grand atout de notre entreprise, c’est notre personnel. Wesco s’engage à favoriser la diversité et l’inclusion au sein de notre effectif en adoptant les perspectives uniques, l’authenticité et l’individualité de plus de 20 000 employés de Wesco dans le monde entier. Grâce à nos groupes de ressources d’entreprise , à notre régime d’avantages sociaux complet et à nos initiatives de sensibilisation de la communauté, vous pouvez faire partie d’une communauté de travail accueillante qui fournit des plateformes pour votre réussite.

Apprenez-en plus sur le travail chez Wesco ici et postulez en ligne dès aujourd’hui !

Fondée en 1922 et basée à Pittsburgh, Wesco est une société cotée en bourse (NYSE : WCC) classée au FORTUNE 500®.

title: Channel Director - Walmart
description:
At Beiersdorf, we want to help people feel good about their skin – and our commitment goes far beyond caring for skin. For 140 years, we have developed innovative skin and body care products for well-known brands such as NIVEA, Eucerin, La Prairie, Elastoplast, and Coppertone. We act according to our purpose, WE CARE BEYOND SKIN, and take responsibility for our consumers, our employees, the environment and society.

Behind every brand, every product and every accomplishment are our more than 20,000 employees. It is for them that we live a culture of inclusion, respect and trust that is strongly aligned with our values – CARE, COURAGE, SIMPLICITY and TRUST. We embrace diversity by valuing the uniqueness of each individual and being committed to equal opportunities for all.

The Sales Channel Director of Walmart is a key member of the Sales Leadership Team at Beiersdorf. The successful candidate will be responsible for driving the ambition, executing effective strategies to facilitate profitable sales growth at Walmart while overseeing the Field Sales broker partner operations. The successful candidate will have an entrepreneurial mindset, strong financial acumen and a passion to drive transformational growth in our largest retail and channel (Discount). Thought leadership and an ability to be data driven will be keys to success. You will be responsible for developing and retaining sales talent, as well as leveraging strong cross-functional relationships with Shopper and Customer Marketing, Brand Marketing, Finance, and Supply Chain.

Your Main Responsibilities
• Lead the Walmart Canada & Discount channel key account managers team
• Align the development & implementation of strategic business plans with Walmart Field sales team (Broker)
• Foster and develop senior level relationships with Walmart and relevant stakeholders in the industry
• Be a subject matter expert and advocate for Walmart key initiatives within Beiersdorf as well as Discount channel penetration and development
• Ensure delivery of sales and KPI scorecard metrics for Beiersdorf in Walmart stores
• Deliver top line and bottom-line growth objectives while achieving brand share gains in your channel,
• Optimize budget for trade, promotions, and shopper marketing programs
• Lead customer JBP and innovation summits across multiple departments to provide feedback on new item concepts and account opportunities for growth

Your Profile
• BS/BA required, MBA or Master’s degree preferred
• Experience in Customer Packaged Goods Industry with Walmart Canada
• Proven track record of thriving in fast-paced environment with ambiguity
• 10+ years of CPG Sales, Sales Strategy, or similar discipline experience
• Leadership experiences with proven track record of developing high performing teams, build strong relationships across functions and ability to influence key decision makers
• Strategic thinker with the ability to leverage data sources like Nielsen and increase effectiveness at achieving overall strategies in a highly collaborative environment
• Exceptional oral and written communication skills to influence and secure cross-functional support at all levels in the organisation
• Must have high level analytical skills and finance acumen to build strong business cases for change,
• Office productivity software skills (e.g., PowerPoint, Excel, SAP) to use promotion databases, financial reporting, and promotional analysis

Additional Information

Experience, skills and competencies that lend themselves to this role

We know that experience comes in all forms and we’re not necessarily looking for individuals who can hit the ground running (‘check all the boxes’) but may bring a unique blend of competence and capabilities that can grow into a role and/or bring news skills to the team.

A welcoming workplace that offers personal and professional growth for all individuals

At Beiersdorf, You’ll Find
• A welcoming workplace that fosters diversity, inclusion and belonging where every team member feels valued, respected, and supported
• Nimble teams that enjoy challenging work and the ability to make an impact
• A dynamic community of life-long learners that values acumen, aptitude and the ability to learn as well as hard skills and established expertise
• A purpose-led company that cares about your personal and professional development with the right balance of structure and flexibility to thrive
• A collaborative culture that leads with care, trust, simplicity and courage

Unique Benefits That Consider The Whole Person

We understand that you have a life outside of work, and we support you with unique benefits including:
• Generous and flexible vacation policy
• Summer Friday hours
• Comprehensive Wellness and Benefits program
• Growing number of Employee Resource Groups or affinity groups - to foster meaningful connections and belonging with other colleagues
• Dynamic work model – a hybrid of in-office collaboration (3 days/week) and remote focused work days

title: Business Operations Manager
description:
This role involves ensuring the smooth functioning of our facility, managing resources, and supporting a team to ensure all medical procedure rooms are full all the time. Ensuring that supplies are kept full and inventory is ordered daily.

Key Responsibilities
• Operational excellence: Ensure the smooth running of the clinic's day-to-day operations in 20 treatment rooms. Proactively identify areas for improvement and implement innovative solutions. Independently oversee projects and operations, ensuring high quality results with minimal supervision.
• Managing all aspects of the electronic medical record system (Zenoti at this time), including programming and customising forms, updating services, troubleshooting technical issues, and ensuring compliance with healthcare regulations.
• Inventory and Supply Management: Oversee the procurement process, ensuring timely acquisition and adequate stock levels of medical supplies and equipment.
• Financial supervision: Manage all aspects of the clinic's finances, including bill payment, supplier relations, and contribute to budgeting and financial reporting.
• Policy development and updating: Formulate and update clinic policies and procedures.
• Customer experience management: Ensure patients receive exceptional care and oversee customer satisfaction initiatives.

Requirements

- Bachelor's degree in business

- Minimum 2 years experience as a business manager.

- Leadership and team management skills

- Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written).

- Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.

- Proficiency with electronic medical record systems (e.g., Zenoti) and general computer literacy.

- Problem-solving and critical thinking skills.

- Financial management skills, including budgeting and financial reporting.

- Knowledge of healthcare regulations and compliance.

- Exceptional customer service skills.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: $59,518.30-$74,999.00 per year

Benefits:
• Dental care
• Extended health care
• Paid time off

Schedule:
• Monday to Friday

Education:
• Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:
• management: 3 years (required)

Work Location: In person

------

This role involves ensuring the smooth functioning of our facility, managing resources, and supporting a team to ensure all medical procedure rooms are full all the time. Ensuring that supplies are kept full and inventory is ordered daily.

Excellence opérationnelle
• Superviser les opérations quotidiennes de la clinique, incluant la gestion de 20 salles de traitement.
• Identifier des opportunités d'amélioration et mettre en œuvre des solutions innovantes.
• Piloter des projets de manière autonome tout en assurant des résultats de haute qualité.

Gestion des systèmes électroniques de dossiers médicaux
• Gérer et optimiser notre système de gestion (actuellement Zenoti), incluant :
• La personnalisation des formulaires et des services.
• La résolution des problèmes techniques.
• L'assurance de la conformité avec les normes de santé.

Gestion des stocks et approvisionnements
• Superviser les commandes quotidiennes et maintenir des niveaux adéquats de fournitures et équipements médicaux.
• Collaborer avec les fournisseurs pour éviter les ruptures de stock.

Supervision financière
• Gérer les finances de la clinique : paiement des factures, relations fournisseurs, préparation des budgets et des rapports financiers.

Amélioration de l’expérience client
• Assurer une expérience client exceptionnelle en développant des initiatives pour renforcer la satisfaction des patients.
• Former et encadrer l'équipe pour maintenir un service à la clientèle exemplaire.

Ce que nous recherchonsCompétences clés
• * Excellentes compétences en communication orale et écrite en français et en anglais, essentielles pour interagir efficacement avec une clientèle diversifiée, incluant des patients exclusivement anglophones.
• Expérience démontrée en gestion d’entreprise (minimum 2 ans).
• Compétences solides en organisation et en gestion de priorités.
• Expérience en gestion de projets techniques ou IT.
• Maîtrise des outils informatiques et des systèmes de gestion
• Compétences en analyse financière et budgétisation.

Pourquoi nous rejoindre?

Nous offrons un environnement dynamique et stimulant où votre contribution aura un impact direct sur notre succès. En plus d'un salaire compétitif, vous bénéficierez :
• Salaire : 59 518 $ à 74 999 $ par année.
• Avantages : assurance santé, assurance dentaire et congés payés.
• Horaires : du lundi au vendredi (temps plein).
• Une culture collaborative et axée sur l’innovation.

Votre profil
• Diplôme : Baccalauréat en administration des affaires (ou domaine connexe).
• Expérience : Minimum 3 ans en gestion.

Lieu de travail

En présentiel, dans un cadre moderne et chaleureux, conçu pour offrir la meilleure expérience à notre équipe et à nos patients.

title: Senior Business Manager
description:
LE CHALLENGE

Notre agence de Montréal recherche un Senior Business Manager au sein de son marché porteur en forte croissance. Nous vous proposons de rejoindre une société de conseil experte en management de projet, où vous démarchez et gérez vos clients, constituez votre équipe et managez votre centre de profit.

Engagez-vous dans un parcours de carrière dynamique aux objectifs ambitieux !

Votre objectif est de créer des réseaux, de développer des affaires et de créer des relations à long terme avec les clients, les candidats et les consultants.

En tant que Senior Business Manager, vous pilotez ainsi 3 éléments essentiels de l’organisation :
• Business Développement : vous identifiez les opportunités de croissance de votre business unit, pilotez votre périmètre en développant les relations avec les clients grands comptes et concluez la vente de prestations de service de management de projet.
• Recrutement et Management : vous recrutez (en collaboration avec les chargés de recrutement) accompagnez et développez votre équipe de consultants spécialistes du management de projets ainsi qu'une équipe de business manager. En véritable leader, vous veillez au bon déroulement des missions, vous identifiez les potentiels de vos équipes et les suivez tout au long de leur parcours (coaching, entretiens, gestion de carrière…).
• Gestion de Centre de profit : vous vous assurez de l’atteinte des objectifs de chiffre d’affaire et de rentabilité de votre business unit tout en garantissant la satisfaction client.

LE CANDIDAT IDEAL

Vous êtes issu(e) d’une formation supérieure (Baccalauréat, DESS, Maitrise) en école d'ingénieurs ou de commerce et vous disposez d'une expérience technique ou commerciale réussie d'au moins trois ans.
• Vous vous intéressez aux différents secteurs et défis industriels actuels et vous avez idéalement découvert le Management de Projet lors de l’une de vos expériences.
• Vous avec un niveau courant en français et en anglais, qui vous permet d'échanger et d'animer des réunions.
• Votre réussite à ce poste reposera sur votre approche business et résultats alliée à votre rigueur ainsi que votre volonté d’animer et fédérer des équipes pluridisciplinaires.
• Votre capacité à établir et entretenir des relations de confiance sera également indispensable à votre succès.

NOTRE PROMESSE

En intégrant notre structure en tant que Senior Business Manager, vous serez épaulé par le Responsable de votre agence. Nous vous accompagnerons dans votre montée en compétences sur les sujets de management, recrutement, commerce et leadership. Vos performances vous garantiront une évolution de carrière rapide.

L'emploi du genre masculin a pour but d'alléger le texte et d'en faciliter la lecture.

title: Responsable développement commercial
description:
About Us:

We are a Montreal-based agency specializing in image management, marketing, and communication. With a proven track record of transforming brands and businesses. Our mission is to help businesses enhance their visibility, reputation, and customer engagement through cutting-edge branding, strategic marketing, and tailored communication services.

Whether it’s through social media management, SEO strategies, or full-service branding, we offer comprehensive solutions that help businesses stand out in an increasingly competitive landscape.

The Role:

We’re seeking a passionate and self-driven Freelance business development representative to join our growing team. This is more than just a sales role—it’s an opportunity to build a career on your own terms, leveraging your network and communication skills to make a tangible difference for businesses while creating a reliable stream of passive income for yourself.

As a representative, your mission will be to connect with local businesses, stores, and offices in your area that struggle with ineffective communication, poor branding, or weak marketing strategies. You’ll introduce them to our innovative service packages, designed to revitalize their image, boost their marketing impact, and drive customer engagement.

What We Offer:
• Total Freedom and Autonomy: You set your own hours, work where you want, and run your business your way.
• Passive Income Potential: Our subscription-based service packages allow you to build a steady, recurring revenue stream. With enough effort, you could stop working while continuing to earn income month after month.
• No Degree or Prior Experience Required: Success in this role depends on your motivation, ambition, and communication skills—not your resume.
• Supportive Team: While you’re independent, you’re never alone. Our agency provides all the tools, resources, and support you need to succeed.

Key Responsibilities:
• Identify businesses in your area with underwhelming marketing, branding, or communication strategies.
• Professionally present and explain our comprehensive service packages and their value to these businesses.
• Build trust and long-term relationships with clients, helping them see the benefits of partnering with our agency.
• Meet and exceed sales targets to grow your portfolio and build a foundation for passive income.

Who You Are:
• Highly Motivated: You’re hungry for success and ready to take charge of your career.
• Exceptional Communicator: You have a natural talent for connecting with people and presenting ideas clearly and confidently.
• Goal-Oriented: You thrive on challenges and are determined to achieve your objectives.
• Entrepreneurial Spirit: You see the value in creating your own opportunities and taking control of your future.

Why This Opportunity Is Different:

This isn’t a typical 9-to-5 sales job. It’s a chance to create real financial freedom through effort, strategy, and relationship-building. As you onboard clients, you’re not just earning a one-time commission—you’re creating a passive income stream that will pay off month after month, year after year.

You’ll be empowered to operate independently, but you’ll also benefit from the guidance and expertise of an agency that’s dedicated to your success. This is your opportunity to make a real impact, both for yourself and for the businesses you help.

Ready to Take the First Step?
• Join us and build your future with an agency that values your ambition and drive. Apply now to become part of a growing team that’s transforming businesses and empowering professionals to succeed on their own terms.

title: SRV Canada VRS – Customer Service Representative
description:
SRV Canada VRS – Customer Service Representative

IVèS (www.ives.fr) is a communications company that develops, integrates and deploys innovative services in the fields of e-health, videoconferencing and relay centres, and it is on the forefront of bringing video relay technology to Deaf and hard-of-hearing communities around the world.

Canadian Administrator of Video Relay Service (CAV), Inc. (www.cav-acs.ca) is a not-for-profit corporation that has been mandated by the Canadian Radio-television and Telecommunications Commission (CRTC) to design, implement and oversee the delivery of video relay service (VRS) in Canada.

IVèS has been chosen by CAV to deliver the technology platform and customer services support to Canada VRS. VRS will allow Deaf and hard-of-hearing Canadians who use sign language to engage in real-time telephone conversations by connecting the customer to a sign language interpreter through an internet-based videoconferencing technology.

IVèS is currently seeking Customer Service Representatives to enhance customers’ VRS experience by providing outstanding customer service to both Deaf and hearing customers. Position is based in Montréal and this is what we offer:
• Working with deaf colleagues and communication is mainly in LSQ and ASL.
• Regular in-house training and weekly team meetings with a Sign Language Interpreter on site.
• Actual working hours 9am to 9pm on some weekdays and 11am to 5pm on Saturday. Breaks are offered in the morning and afternoon.
• Traveling across Canada and around to meet deaf users in many community’s events to promote the service.
• We offer a Health Insurance and Reer pension fund.
• The company is ideally located in Montreal, near the Jean Talon market and De Castelnau metro station is 5 minutes far from the office.

If you want to work in the deaf community, value sign language and believe in the empowerment of deaf people, don’t miss this opportunity of Customer Service Representative position.

Responsibilities will include:
• Resolving Deaf and hearing customers’ inquiries and concerns regarding Canada VRS
• Assisting customers with the installation of user software on their computers
• Handling requests for registration and activation, completing customer service records and maintaining an up-to-date database
• Applying resolution procedures if customer reports a service issue and coordinating with support engineer if service issue requires escalation
• Collecting technical information to further analyze issues
• Maintaining up-to-date knowledge about Canada VRS products and services

Candidates should have the following skills and/or experience:
• Fluent in both written English or French and American Sign Language (ASL) AND Langue des Signes Québécoise (LSQ)
• Experience working with Deaf or hard-of-hearing individuals and an understanding of Deaf culture
• Excellent communication skills
• General IT experience and knowledge, including computer support and software installation
• Ability to handle a large volume of calls efficiently and recommending appropriate solutions
• Video relay and/or video conferencing experience is preferred
• Knowledge and experience with VoIP technology is an asset
• Previous customer service experience is recommanded

Please submit your résumé and cover letter to Nelly Plateau by email at administrationca@ives-inc.ca

title: Customer Service Agent - Remote - Focus Group Panelist - $75-$150 per hour
description:
Job Title: Remote Customer Service Representative Agent, Work From Home Panelists

Part-time Focus Group Participants - Remote Work From Home (Potential earnings: Up to $850/Week)

Description:

We are seeking individuals to participate in National & Local Paid Focus Groups, Clinical Trials, and Phone Interviews.
Most of our paid focus group studies offer the option to participate remotely online or in-person. This opportunity provides the advantage of earning additional income from the comfort of your home.
We require participants for the following topics:

- Child-related (for individuals with children 18 years or younger)
- Cell Phones (users of Apple, Android, or Windows...Both prepaid or contract)
- Entertainment (includes TV shows, movies, and video games)
- Food (applicable if you purchase fast food, casual dining, or upscale dining)
- Sports (both casual viewers and die-hard fans)
- Electronics (sharing opinions about preferred devices)
- Pets (calling all animal enthusiasts! We discuss dogs, cats, and other pets)
- Automobiles (comments from those who own, make payments, or lease their vehicles)

Responsibilities:

- Arrive at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time
- Follow and complete written and oral instructions
- Complete the written survey provided for each panel
- Users of products and/or services, must be ready for discussion PRIOR to meeting date

Qualifications:

- Must possess a smartphone with a functional camera or a desktop/laptop equipped with a webcam
- Reliable internet connection is required
- Enthusiasm to fully participate in one or several mentioned topics
- Ability to understand and follow both oral and written instructions
- Prior experience as a Customer Service Representative Agent is not essential

Job Benefits:

- Option to participate in discussions online or in-person (flexibility)
- Work from home eliminates need for commuting
- No set hours, part-time or full-time work available
- Free samples from our sponsors and partners are provided in exchange for your honest product feedback
- Opportunity to review and use new products or services ahead of public release

Compensation:

- Pay range of $75-$150 (per 1-hour session)
- Pay range of $300-$850 (for multi-session studies)

Visit our website to apply and complete the questionnaire to determine your qualification for the position. This role is ideal for anyone seeking temporary, part-time, or full-time work. The flexible hours are an added advantage and prior experience is not a prerequisite. Whether you're a customer service representative agent or someone seeking a flexible part-time remote work-from-home job, this is an excellent way to boost your income.

title: Bilingual Contact Centre Representative
description:
Work Location:

Montréal, Quebec, Canada

Hours:

37.5

Line of Business:

Personal & Commercial Banking

Pay Details:

45,700 $ /$45,700 - 61,000$/ $61,000 CAD

TD is committed to providing fair and equitable compensation opportunities to all colleagues. Growth opportunities and skill development are defining features of the colleague experience at TD. Our compensation policies and practices have been designed to allow colleagues to progress through the salary range over time as they progress in their role. The base pay actually offered may vary based upon the candidate's skills and experience, job-related knowledge, geographic location, and other specific business and organizational needs.

As a candidate, you are encouraged to ask compensation related questions and have an open dialogue with your recruiter who can provide you more specific details for this role.

Job Description:

What You ’ ll Do

As the voice of TD, you’ll be passionate about understanding our customers. Whether you’re assisting in-bound customers with account inquiries or resolving an issue by recommending a TD product or service, you’ll help us offer personalized support to our customers whenever they need it. You’ll consistently deliver legendary customer service by making it easy, creating value, and delivering trusted advice to our customers.

As a valued member of our Contact Centre Team, you will:
• Make people ’ s day : strive to deliver an exceptional customer service experience by offering friendly support through your knowledge of TD products, services and solutions.
• Solve problems efficiently: resolve customer inquiries at the first point of contact by asking questions and responding with empathy to their concerns.
• Achieve your goals: consistently reach performance objectives, including customer experience survey results, advice and quality goals, compliance regulations, and productivity targets.
• Never stop learning: actively participate in ongoing training and coaching support to help you continue togrow and develop in your role.

Job Requirements

What You Need to Succeed

We’re proud to work with a group of diverse colleagues. If you have relevant experience that isn’t mentioned below, tell us about it in your resume or cover letter.
• High School Diploma or equivalent
• Bilingual – French & English
• Exceptional listening skills and a curiosity to help customers meet their needs and resolve concerns. (Preference given to those with experience in financial or service industries.)
• Ability to multitask and navigate through computer systems,applications, and multiple screens with speed and accuracy while balancing performance to meet a variety of metrics.
• Digital literacy across a broad range of devices (e.g., smartphones, tablets, laptops, headsets, etc.).
• Flexibility, resiliency, and a positive attitude when responding to challenging situations.
• Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
• Integrity when managing sensitive customer information in alignment with Regulatory and Compliance guidelines related to servicing and sales practices.

Language Requirement

title: Customer Service Representative - Remote (Bilingual: French / English)
description:
Our client, a leader in the telecommunications industry, is seeking a bilingual (French/English) Customer Service Representative based in Montreal. This position is ideal for an organized, detail-oriented professional with excellent customer service skills and the ability to handle a high volume of client requests. This role primarily allows remote work, with a requirement to work onsite twice per month as per a preset schedule.

Career Growth: Opportunity for extension or potential conversion to a full-time role (though not guaranteed).

Enjoy remote work flexibility with occasional onsite requirements in Montreal.

Utilize CRM software to process and manage customer requests.

Maintain inventory records and complete service orders.

Process invoices and handle billing efficiently.

Assist with side projects related to ticketing and billing.

Minimum of 3 years of experience in a customer service role.

Bilingual (French/English) – required for client interaction and interviews.

Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).

Basic accounting knowledge is an asset.

If you’re a disciplined, autonomous customer service professional with strong organizational skills and bilingual proficiency, apply today to join our client’s team in the telecommunications industry. This role offers flexibility and the chance to build your expertise in a customer-facing, remote role with occasional onsite responsibilities.

title: PIA Client Service Associate
description:
Work Location:

Canada

0

Pay Details:

We’re committed to providing fair and equitable compensation to all our colleagues. As a candidate, we encourage you to have an open dialogue with a member of our HR Team and ask compensation related questions, including pay details for this role.

Job Description:

Department Overview :

TD Private Wealth Management takes a sophisticated and holistic goals discovery approach to wealth planning and protection to provide highly personalized advice, solutions and service to clients.

TD Private Investment Advice offers clients the chance to create one-on-one relationship with a dedicated and professional Investment Advisor, while maintaining active participation in decisions regarding their investment portfolio. It's a very special and supportive place to begin – and grow – a lasting, progressive and rewarding career in wealth.

Job Description :

Are you admired for your attention to detail, exacting standards and willingness to help others deliver a legendary customer experience to our high value clients? If so, then get onboard for the position of PIA Client Service Associate. In this role, you will provide dedicated specialized administrative support to an Investment Advisor or team of Advisors on diverse assignments. You may also correspond with clients and other branch staff. In this frontline role, your first impressions will leave lasting results on our business and customer experience.

In addition, you will:
• Prepare documentation and provide updates to IAs in preparation for client meetings
• Create reports for analysis of client accounts; communicate with customers to provide mentorship on products and services, and identify referral opportunities
• Accept/create leads and ensure correct referral coding administration
• Submit marketing pieces for approval, compile client information packages, maintain marketing materials and "Marketing Express" mail-outs
• Familiarize and adhere to compliance requirements, including all aspects of new and existing account documentation and marketing materials
• Provide a high level of client service which includes responding to phone, mail and electronic enquiries based on knowledge of full service brokerage
• Deliver the 'gold standard' client experience at every interaction with team members, colleagues and clients; prioritize and handle own work and consistently exercise discretion
• Adhere to all policies and procedures and maintain a culture and operation of risk management
• Use insights to continually improve individual and team performance for clients
• Participate fully as a team member, continually improve knowledge and keep others informed and up to date about status and progress, issues or other related activities

Job Requirements :
• Undergraduate degree or community college diploma preferred
• Completion of the Canadian Securities Course (CSC) and Conduct and Practices Handbook
• Licensed with Investment Industry Regulatory Organization of Canada (CIRO) as an Investment Representative or Registered Representative
• Strong communication skills with ability to build relationships and work collaboratively, confidentially and independently
