title: Aircraft Maintenance Engineer - Line - Mechanics (Apprentice)
description:
Develop your career with the largest regional airline in Canada! If you are an Apprentice - Aircraft Maintenance Engineer (AME) and value an organization that promotes safety as well as quality work life balance, then the Jazz hangar could be a great place to work for you!

Jazz is Air Canada’s primary regional partner and an integral part of Air Canada’s strategy and North American market presence. Jazz is a proud Air Canada Express operator providing service across North America.

Jazz truly is Canada’s airline! We operate more flights to more Canadian destinations than any other regional carrier and have five main base locations: Halifax, Toronto, Montreal, Calgary and Vancouver.

For a look behind the scenes of Jazz’s operation, watch our video

Meet KEVIN, AME at JAZZ!

Jazz is looking for Apprentice Aircraft Maintenance Engineers (Mechanics) with a passion for safety and customer service to join our award-winning team.

Our over 4,500 employees are supported by programs and policies that have earned Jazz awards such as Canada’s Top Diversity Employers, Canada’s Top Employers for Young People, and more.

Purpose of Position:

To maintain the aircraft in an airworthy condition and carry out maintenance tasks as required.

Key Responsibilities:

You will:
• Carry out maintenance duties on Jazz aircraft;
• Report on issues affecting the serviceability of aircraft;
• Ensure aircraft are maintained in accordance with Company and Transport Canada regulations;
• Perform duties in accordance with our established policies and procedures while giving primary consideration to personal safety, the safety of co-workers and customers.

Qualifications:
• Must be a graduate of an accredited Transport Canada approved Aircraft Maintenance Engineer program (Mechanics).
• Must have received Transport Canada Accreditation.
• Must hold a valid Canadian issued driver’s license with no restrictions and/or conditions.
• Legally able to work in Canada (Canadian Citizen, Permanent Resident or on a Valid Work Permit).
• Ability to carry on normal business in English.

Opportunities:
• Our Apprentice AMEs are given the opportunity to complete all the Transport Canada tasks required to obtain their AME License.
• When positions are available, AMEs are given the opportunity to transfer bases if desired.
• Jazz offers opportunities for career advancement.

Wages:

The positions in our Maintenance Department are unionized positions. Current pay scales are outlined in our collective agreement.
• Pay scales are competitive and progress every 6 months to 1 year.
• AMEs qualify for a Technical Premium which is paid on top of the base wage for every hour worked.

What Jazz can offer you...
• Employee travel benefits program on the Air Canada Network.
• Defined contribution Pension Plan.
• A comprehensive care plan including health, life, dental and disability benefits.

We strive to make our workplace accessible for people with disabilities. We want to ensure that you are prepared for success and therefore request that you please let us know at taleosupport@flyjazz.ca if you would benefit from an accommodation during the recruitment process.

Jazz recognizes that the best talent includes people of all backgrounds, abilities and points of view. To be a leader in our industry, Jazz celebrates diversity and values the uniqueness that each individual has to offer. We empower our people to foster an internal culture of inclusion, creating safe workspaces where everyone can be their authentic self. Meeting the needs of our diverse passengers is critical to our success and we recognize the importance of a workforce that is reflective of the communities we serve.

title: Manager, Business Development (bilingual)
description:
Job ID: 8737

Working Business Language: Bilingual in French and English. This role is considered a regional role and requires regular interaction with internal and external stakeholders across Canada where the business languages utilized are both English and French. As such, the successful candidate must be fully proficient in English and French.

Salary: At Wawanesa, salary is only one component of a holistic, comprehensive and competitive offering that we provide to our employees. In addition to salary, full-time and part-time permanent employees are eligible for an annual bonus plan, leave of absence top-up programs and provided with generous vacation time, personal days, premium free benefits and pension plan.

The salary offered for this role is determined with consideration to various factors, including but not limited to: your work location, local labour market conditions, external market salary data, internal pay equity and the knowledge, skills, experience and anticipated proficiency in the role. The salary offered is estimated to be within the following range: $110,000+. Candidates with salary expectations outside of the range are still encouraged to apply.

About Us

At Wawanesa, we’re proud to offer a hybrid work environment that offers flexibility to our employees in balancing in-office (2 days per week OR 15 hours per week in a Wawanesa office) and remote work. You may work from Montreal, QC.

The Wawanesa Mutual Insurance Company (“Wawanesa Mutual”), founded in 1896, is one of Canada’s largest mutual insurers, with over $3.5 billion in annual revenue and assets of $10 billion (CAD). Wawanesa Mutual, with its National Headquarters in Winnipeg, is the parent company of Wawanesa Life, which provides life insurance products and services throughout Canada, and Western Financial Group, which distributes personal and business insurance across Canada. Wawanesa proudly serves more than 1.7 million members in Canada, and we are home to more than 3,600 employees distributed across the Canadian regions and communities where we operate. We give back to organizations that strengthen communities, donating more than $3.5 million annually to charitable organizations, including over $2 million annually in support of people on the front lines of climate change. To learn more visit wawanesa.com.

We are currently looking for dedicated, driven, and enthusiastic individuals who thrive in an environment that welcomes change and are looking for an opportunity for diverse experience and advancement on a growing team.

Job Overview

The Business Development Manager will lead and manage the business development team and process to; ensure mutual satisfaction and success between Wawanesa and brokerage network, develop staff proficiency, establish and achieve targeted business goals with contracted brokers and team members, and develop opportunities to grow the business with new brokerages and territories within the region, all which reflect Wawanesa’s strategies.

Job Responsibilities
• Provide management, direction, and development to the region business development team which includes; establishing and managing production results, assist in setting and achieving growth and marketing plans based on individual brokerage plans and regional goals, and assessing contracted brokers benefit or risk to regional goals.
• Share your knowledge, collaborate, and coach team members (both in Quebec and nationally) as well as with external partners.
• Develop, lead, and monitor marketing campaigns and business development initiatives.
• Identify opportunities and assist in the review of non-contracted brokerages and territories to achieve growth and production plans.
• Maintain an exceptional understanding and knowledge of the changing marketplace, products, brokerages, and competitors.
• Work effectively with the region’s functional departments and management teams to achieve plans and goals, which includes; leading marketing product launches, training sessions, facilitating meetings with Wawanesa and brokerage staff, implementing underwriting plans.
• Provide recommendations and expertise in the creation and implementation of business development strategies and marketing campaigns.
• Act as an escalation point between Wawanesa and brokers to ensure flow of communication and assist in solving any company/brokerage concerns.
• Liaise and coordinate efforts with executive Business Development department and Insurance Solutions department as required.
• Perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifications
• 10 years of insurance experience or relevant business development experience.
• Bilinguisme à l'écrit et à l'oral en français et en anglais.
• Successful completion of post-secondary education, and/or successful completion of a P&C industry designation.
• Proficient Microsoft Office.
• Proven leadership skills with the ability to motivate and engage team members.
• Excellent planning and organizing skills involving goal setting and results measurement, with the ability to develop effective plans that define activities, resources and timelines.
• Excellent presentation and training skills with the ability to effectively facilitate sessions and deliver powerful presentations.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to express ideas clearly and ensure understanding.
• Excellent team player who facilitates high morale by encouraging others to be excited, motivated, and enthusiastic.
• Excellent analytical skills with the ability to identify relationships, problems and issues.
• Understanding and exposure to product development, pricing, and implementation would be considered an asset.
• Willingness to travel and visit brokers within territory regularly.
• A valid driver’s license.

#LI-AF1 #LI-Hybrid

Wawanesa is proud to be one of Manitoba’s Top Employers, a Kincentric Best Employer in Canada and a Forbes Best Employer in Canada recognizing an exceptional place to work!

Diversity Equity, Inclusion & Belonging

Wawanesa is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering a diverse workforce that is equitable and inclusive for all. Wawanesa provides equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants without regard to an individual’s protected status: race/ethnicity, colour, religion, creed, sex or gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, family or marital status, pregnancy/childbirth or related conditions, national origin, disability, military or veteran status, or any other protected status. Disability or medical-related accommodations are available upon request throughout all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. Candidates requiring reasonable accommodations may contact, in confidence, jobs@wawanesa.com.

title: Senior Business Development Manager
description:
About us

Firebyte Games is currently looking for a Senior Business Development Manager to join our growing team.Believing that good ideas come from great people with an outside-the-box mindset and a continuous thirst for knowledge.

Our team is diverse and made up of industry veterans and experts in their field.

We are searching for an experienced Senior Business Development Manager (Mobile Gaming Industry, Outsourcing) to join our team and develop new business opportunities for Firebyte Games.

The ideal candidate must be an experienced, dynamic, motivated, high performing new Business Development professional, selling outsourcing and co-development solutions in his/her existing and worldwide network of game industry outsourcing managers, with a proven track record in the mobile gaming industry.

Day-to-Day Responsibilities:
• Self-generating new leads, appointments and referrals through day to day new business activity.
• Generating and attending meetings with potential outsourcing or co-dev clients.
• Achieve monthly and quarterly sales targets.
• Accurately build, manage, improve, and maintain your sales pipeline.
• Thrive on working in a fast-paced, target focused high energy and high reward culture.
• Review contracts and documentation between Firebyte Games and potential clients.
• Maintaining relationships with existing clients.
• Working closely with the CEO on a business growth strategy and then devising an action plan with goals and objectives

What you Bring to the Team:
• A proven track record within the mobile gaming industry.
• Confident in value based/consultative selling.
• A proven ability to self-generate client referrals and self-sourced leads.
• Deep knowledge of the gaming industry.
• Business intelligence.
• Communication and interpersonal abilities.

In return you will be given:
• Industry leading salary (matching established and reputable studio rates throughout Europe)
• Stock Option Plan based on performance
• Health care plan 100% covered by the company
• Bonuses based on company performance
• Paid time off (sick days, public holidays and vacantions)
• Private retirement plan
• Immediate starts can be accommodated (as can 1-3 month notice periods)
• A permanent and influential position with a growing team lead by industry veterans

Apply today with a recent CV

title: Associate Partner Development Manager
description:
Hi there! Thanks for stopping by

Are you actively looking for a new opportunity? Or just checking the market? Well... you might just be in the right place!

We're looking for an Associate Partner Development Manager, who will be responsible for developing new commercial partnerships that drive new merchants to Lightspeed. Each partner must have an individual Go-To-Market program that aligns the prospects' goals and incentivizes them to bring retailers and restaurateurs to the Lightspeed platform. You will need to have a deep understanding of a potential partner's ambitions, product and industry.

This individual will be accountable for presenting the partnership plan to partner qualified leads , strategy and negotiation of commercials terms, successful and seamless onboarding experience for their partners, and having a presence at large hospitality industry trade shows when required.

What you'll be doing:
• Develop, manage and maintain pipeline to deliver the assigned territories market strategy
• Develop new commercial partnerships that drive new merchants to Lightspeed, both referral and reseller partners
• Through outbound prospecting and inbound qualification, recruit new integration and reseller partnerships
• Meet quotas defined by leadership
• Provide monthly, quarterly, and yearly pipeline reporting and forecasts
• Ensure smooth handover to the allocated Partner Trainer, Partner Growth Manager and Partner Marketing Manager
• Build strong relationships with internal stakeholders and act as an advocate for those partners within Lightspeed
• Responsible for delivering defined ROI, key learning's, reporting and evaluation of partnership impact to drive market share growth, brand awareness and sales
• Strong understanding of current trends, patterns, and events in the industry
• Attend marketing and industry events
• Be a subject matter expert in the POS domain to understand how Lightspeed's suite of products can be applied to all stages of our customer's retail or restaurant operations
• Handle other duties and responsibilities as defined by management

What you need to bring:
• 3-5 years of channel sales experience; Software sales experience preferred
• Experience with generating sales forecasts
• High degree of initiative and self-direction; bias for action
• B2B relationship building skills
• Ability to develop comprehensive growth strategies
• Excellent English oral and written communication skills, group presentation skills
• Ability to thrive in a competitive and fast-moving environment
• Flexibility based on the needs of the business

Even Better if you have:
• SaaS sales experience
• Expert level knowledge of Salesforce, Mac OS, G Suite, Slack and Microsoft Office
• Experience in the Hospitality or Retail industry
• Fluency in other languages

What's in it for you?

Come live the Lightspeed experience...
• Ability to do your job in a truly flexible hybrid environment (3 days/week in office);
• Genuine career opportunities in a company that's creating new jobs everyday;
• Work in a team big enough for growth but lean enough to make a real impact.

... and enjoy a range of benefits that'll keep you happy, healthy, and (not) hungry:
• Lightspeed RSU program (we are all owners)
• Unlimited paid time off policy
• Flexible working policy
• Health insurance
• Health and wellness benefits
• Possibility for transit fees to be covered
• Paid leave assistance for new parents
• Linkedin learning
• Volunteer day

... and so much more!

To all recruitment agencies: Lightspeed does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. If we have not directly engaged your company in writing to supply candidates for a specific vacancy, Lightspeed will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Lightspeed is a proud equal opportunity employer and we are committed to creating an inclusive and barrier-free workplace. Lightspeed welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Where to from here?
Obviously, this has to be mutually beneficial: we want you to step into a role you love, and we want to offer you a place you're proud to come to every day. For a glimpse into our world check out our career page here.

Lightspeed is building communities through commerce, and we need people from all backgrounds and lived experiences to do that. We were founded in 2005, in Montreal's gay village and our original members were all part of the LGBTQ+ community. The ethos of our business has been about inclusion from the very beginning, and we strive to provide a workplace where everyone belongs.

Who we are:
Powering the businesses that are the backbone of the global economy, Lightspeed's one-stop commerce platform helps merchants innovate to simplify, scale, and provide exceptional customer experiences. Our cloud commerce solution transforms and unifies online and physical operations, multichannel sales, expansion to new locations, global payments, financial solutions, and connection to supplier networks.

Founded in Montréal, Canada in 2005, Lightspeed is dual-listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: LSPD) and Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX: LSPD). With teams across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company serves retail, hospitality, and golf businesses in over 100 countries.

Lightspeed handles your information in accordance with our Applicant Privacy Statement.

title: Senior Business Analyst, Data Analytics (T & I) (Telework/Hybrid)
description:
Position Title:

Senior Business Analyst, Data Analytics (T & I) (Telework/Hybrid)

Status of Employment:

Permanent

Position Language Requirement:

English, French

Language Skills:

English (Reading), English (Speaking), English (Writing), French (Reading), French (Speaking), French (Writing)

Work at CBC/Radio-Canada

At CBC/Radio-Canada, we create content that informs, entertains and connects Canadians on multiple platforms. Our successes and accomplishments are driven by embodying and upholding values, which include creativity, integrity, inclusiveness and relevance.

Do you think you have the ability and drive to keep up with this exciting, ever-changing industry? Whether it be in front of the camera, on air, online or behind the scenes, you would be joining a team that thrives on making connections and telling stories that are important to Canadians.

Unposting Date:

2024-12-09 11:59 PM

Behind the scenes, but ahead of the curve: help us develop the next-generation public broadcaster.

Created in 2015 to align, lighten and modernize infrastructure, the Technology & Infrastructure (T & I) team is the backbone and the future forward arm of CBC/Radio-Canada. We are the people that make stuff work. We make connections; between media content, systems, people and places. We are the space in between.

A place with purpose. CBC/Radio-Canada has always been a highly regarded pioneer of media technology. Not just in Canada, but around the world. Today, we’re transforming ourselves from conventional radio and television broadcaster into a modern digital media company. Technology is the driving force and we are the team making it happen.

This role is a hybrid work arrangement. Work schedule to be discussed with Hiring Manager according to the guidelines defined by the department.

The opportunity

You will play a pivotal role in driving organizational success. Your responsibilities will include conducting thorough analysis of complex technical needs, documenting requirements, mapping intricate data and workflows, proactively managing change requests, and effectively bridging the gap between business and technology requirements within the Technology and Infrastructure (T&I) division. This role offers a remarkable opportunity to utilize your expertise in data analytics as a Business Analyst, making a profound impact on our organization's growth and overall success.

In close collaboration with the other members of the team and extended partners, you will:
• Conduct comprehensive analysis of technical needs and requirements, ensuring a deep understanding of the project objectives and stakeholder expectations.
• Document and articulate detailed requirements, capturing both functional and non-functional aspects.
• Perform thorough data and workflow mapping, identifying critical touchpoints and dependencies to ensure seamless integration.
• Participate in the design of best in class solutions using modern D&A tools and technologies.
• Promote D&A architectural consistency and usability standards;
• Facilitate effective communication and collaboration between business stakeholders and technology teams.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including fellow Developers, Scrum Teams, Business Analyst, and infrastructure specialists.
• Engage in change management processes, proactively addressing and managing change requests to ensure smooth project execution.
• Continuously assess and mitigate risks, proactively identifying potential obstacles and developing mitigation strategies.
• Ambassador, sharing your knowledge and experience to foster a collaborative and high-performing team environment.
• Take the lead in conducting quality assurance (QA) activities; define and execute test cases; and coordinate User Acceptance Testing (UAT) sessions, guiding users and ensuring thorough and effective testing.
• Continuously assess technical debt, including bugs and deficiencies, to ensure their resolution. With a sound mindset around operational budgets.
• In addition to these responsibilities, the candidate will be expected to actively engage in the development process. This may include preparing integrations (API, Pipelines etc.).

In addition, your role will involve coordinating activities with the team and keeping the responsible manager informed of any risks and issues encountered. Your attention to detail will be essential as you effectively articulate needs, problems and solutions. Strong communication skills will be crucial in interacting with various stakeholders, utilizing technical terminology when engaging with the T&I team and employing common terms when communicating with business partners.

This role offers the flexibility to be based in either Toronto or Montreal.

What do we have to offer?

By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to contribute and work in a very high collaborative environment where you will have full autonomy to implement your solutions while working with cutting-edge innovation. You will work collaboratively with highly skilled professionals, leveraging their expertise and creativity to make a lasting impact. Together, we will strive to deliver exceptional data content and services that meet the evolving needs of our internal customers.

We are looking for a candidate with the following:
• A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, a College Diploma, or an equivalent qualification is required.
• A minimum of five (5) years of experience as a Business analysis is required.
• Proficiency in requirements gathering, documentation, and analysis methodologies is required.
• Proficiency with a cloud mindset is essential (AWS, Azure, Synapse Analytics, Fabric, Lakehouse, CoPilot)
• Familiarity in SQL, Python, API
• Familiarity SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) & SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
• Familiarity (Power Automate, Power APP, Power BI)
• Familiarity ETL processes and workflows in (Informatica and Synapse Pipelines)
• Familiarity in Cognos Analytics (On-Prem / Cloud)
• Familiarity in TM1 / Planning Analytics (On-Prem / Cloud)
• Knowledge of leading ERP & HCM Solutions & associated data models
• Strong written and verbal communication, interpersonal and customer satisfaction skills.
• Strong ability to effectively lead and manage multiple initiatives simultaneously
• Sharp analytical skills and a willingness to think outside the box to build solutions. Demonstrated ingenuity in devising technical solutions tailored to clients' and projects' requirements.
• Adaptable, forward-thinking, and energetic
• Proficiency in working within a dynamic and collaborative environment, seamlessly collaborating with multiple teams, and embracing change and new processes.
• Certification: Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or International Institute of
• Business Analysis (IIBA) or Professional Business Analyst (PMI-PBA) a valuable asset
• Bilingualism (proficiency in both spoken and written French and English) is considered an asset.
• Agile mindset working in a Kanban environment.

Candidates may be subject to skills and knowledge testing.

We thank all applicants for their interest, but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

CBC/Radio-Canada is committed to being a leader in reflecting our country’s diversity. That’s because we can only create and tell the stories that connect Canadians, by having a workforce that mirrors the ever-changing makeup of our country. That’s why we, as an employer, value equal opportunity and nurture an inclusive workplace where our individual differences are not only recognized and valued, but also extend to and pervade all the services we provide as Canada’s public broadcaster. For more information, visit the Diversity and Inclusion section of our website. If you have accommodation needs at this stage of the recruitment process, please inform us as soon as possible by sending an e-mail to recruitment@cbc.ca.

You are invited to consult and familiarize yourself with our Code of Conduct, which can be found on our corporate website. All employees must adhere to the Code as a condition of employment. We also invite you to take a look at our policy on conflicts of interest. In the event that you become an employee, it will be important to inform us, as quickly as possible, of any situation that, because of your hiring, constitutes or could appear to constitute a conflict of interest.

title: Data Analyst - Working From Home
description:
At Keyrus, we live and breathe innovation and technology. As a leading French company with over 28 years of global expertise, we operate in 26 countries with a network of 3,500+ talented consultants worldwide.

Keyrus Canada is a recognized leader in Data Intelligence, combining the agility of an innovative startup with the support of a global brand. We work on exciting projects designed to help companies enhance performance through two core areas:

Data Strategy: Helping organizations set clear business objectives and maximize their data to achieve them through BI Roadmaps, Data Governance, and Master Data Management.

Data Intelligence: Empowering companies to derive valuable insights for business decisions with expertise in Data Integration, Cloud Migration, Business Intelligence, and Machine Learning.

Position: Data Technology Consultant

Experience Level: Mid-level Consultant (3-5 years)

Keyrus Canada is seeking a Data Technology Consultant skilled in end-to-end data engineering and analytics. In this role, you’ll deliver data insights across the analytics spectrum, from backend data engineering to front-end visualization, while working directly with clients. You’ll leverage top tools like Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, Azure, and Snowflake to enhance their data intelligence.

Collaborate with client business teams to understand requirements and translate them into technical solutions.

Build, maintain, and optimize backend data solutions, including data preparation, cleansing, and ETL processes.

Design and implement data visualizations that effectively communicate insights, using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, and Qlik.

Support and lead data migrations and integrations within platforms like Power BI and Azure.

Work independently in client-facing scenarios, handling client communications and managing project timelines to ensure the highest quality delivery.

Our ideal candidate brings a balance of technical skills and consulting experience:

3-5 years of hands-on experience in roles such as Business Intelligence Developer, Data Engineer, Data Consultant or similars

Proficiency in Azure, Snowflake, and Power BI is essential ; familiarity with Tableau, Qlik, DBT, Databricks, and Talend is a strong plus.

Solid knowledge of data visualization principles and best practices, especially within Power BI, Tableau, and Qlik.

Experience with data mapping, blending, and ETL processes, with skills in tools like Talend, Data Bricks, DBT being advantageous.

A Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field is required.

Flexible work-from-home policy.

Language courses (French & English) to support continuous learning.

Ready to Make Data Matter?

Join Keyrus and become part of an innovative team, where your expertise will help transform data into actionable insights.

title: Représentant des ventes à domicile
description:
Pourquoi Choisir Lifestyle Home Products ?

Êtes-vous un professionnel passionné de la vente à la recherche d'une opportunité excitante pour faire avancer votre carrière ? Chez Lifestyle Home Products, nous sommes bien plus qu'un simple fabricant leader de vérandas, fenêtres et portes ; nous sommes une famille dédiée à la transformation des maisons et des vies ! En tant que partenaire national de Jacuzzi Bath Remodel, nous avons bâti une réputation de confiance et d'excellence depuis plus de 35 ans.

C'est votre chance de faire partie de notre croissance dynamique et d'augmenter vos revenus !

Votre Potentiel de Gains :
• Commissions illimitées : Vos revenus reflètent vos efforts ! Avec un objectif de rémunération (OTE) d'environ 80 000 CAD par an, beaucoup de nos meilleurs performeurs doublent ce montant !
• Bonus lucratifs : Des ventes exceptionnelles méritent des récompenses exceptionnelles. Nous reconnaissons et célébrons vos réussites

Pourquoi Vous Êtes le Candidat Idéal ?

Nous recherchons des professionnels de la vente motivés et axés sur les résultats, qui prospèrent dans un environnement compétitif. Si vous aimez conclure des affaires et aider les clients à réaliser la maison de leurs rêves, vous avez votre place avec nous !

Votre Rôle :
• Conclure des affaires : Votre principal objectif sera de conclure des ventes et de dépasser les objectifs !
• Approche centrée sur le client : Engagez-vous avec les clients pour comprendre leurs besoins, les informer sur nos produits innovants et les guider vers des solutions de design personnalisées
• Suivre notre processus éprouvé : Suivez notre stratégie de vente éprouvée tout en contribuant aux réunions d'équipe qui favorisent la collaboration et la croissance
• Formation continue : Profitez de sessions de formation régulières conçues pour affiner vos compétences et vous maintenir à la pointe du secteur

Ce dans quoi vous excellerez :
• Axé sur les résultats : Vous avez une volonté inébranlable de conclure des affaires et de dépasser les objectifs de vente
• Confiance et compétitivité : Votre confiance brille dans vos interactions avec les clients, faisant de vous un leader dans n'importe quel environnement de vente
• Engagement client : Vous aimez établir des relations et faire une différence dans la vie des clients

Principales Responsabilités :
• Dépasser les objectifs de vente : Non seulement atteindre, mais surpasser constamment vos objectifs de vente
• Voyager dans le territoire : Visiter les domiciles des clients dans votre zone assignée pour les informer sur nos produits exceptionnels
• Négociation stratégique : Exploiter les promotions actuelles et les solutions abordables pour conclure des ventes
• Autonomiser les clients : Aider les clients à transformer leur maison en l’espace de leurs rêves !

Exigences :
• Éducation : Une formation post-secondaire est préférable
• Permis de conduire : Un permis de conduire valide et un véhicule fiable sont indispensables
• Mobilité : Vous devez être prêt à voyager dans votre territoire de vente pour des consultations à domicile
• Motivation : Autonome et capable de s'épanouir dans un environnement de travail à domicile
• Disponibilité : Des heures en soirée et certains samedis seront nécessaires pour répondre aux besoins des clients

Expérience :
• Expérience en vente : 3 à 5 ans d'expérience en vente à commission sont fortement recommandés

Pourquoi Lifestyle Home Products ?

Nous célébrons la diversité, la collaboration et le respect au sein de notre équipe. Notre culture encourage le partage d'idées et le soutien mutuel dans notre croissance. Nous nous engageons à un processus de recrutement sans obstacles. Si vous avez besoin d'aménagements pendant le processus de candidature, veuillez nous contacter à hr@lifestylehp.ca — nous sommes là pour vous aider !

Saisissez l'Opportunité !

Join Our Winning Team as an In-Home Sales Consultant!

Company:Lifestyle Home Products

Location:Various locations across Quebec

Employment Type:Full Commission

Why Choose Lifestyle Home Products?

Are you a passionate sales professional looking for an exciting opportunity to elevate your career? At Lifestyle Home Products, we’re more than just a leading manufacturer of Sunrooms, Windows, and Doors; we are a family dedicated to transforming homes and lives! As the national partner of Jacuzzi Bath Remodel, we have built a reputation for trust and excellence for over 35 years.

This is your chance to be part of our dynamic growth and take your earnings to new heights!

Your Earning Potential:
• Uncapped Commissions:Your income reflects your effort! With an On Target Earnings (OTE) ofapproximately $80,000 CAD per year, many of our top performers double this amount!
• Lucrative Bonuses:Exceptional sales merit exceptional rewards. We recognize and celebrate your achievements

What Makes You a Perfect Fit?

We are looking for motivated, results-driven sales professionals who thrive in a competitive environment. If you love closing deals and helping clients realize their dream home, you belong with us!

Your Role:
• Close Deals:Your primary focus will be on closing sales and exceeding targets!
• Customer-Centric Approach:Engage with clients to understand their needs, educate them about our innovative products, and guide them toward personalized design solutions
• Follow Our Proven Process:Adhere to our successful sales strategy while contributing to team meetings that foster collaboration and growth
• Ongoing Training:Benefit from regular training sessions designed to sharpen your skills and keep you at the forefront of the industry

What You’ll Excel At:
• Results-Oriented:You have a relentless drive to close deals and exceed sales goals
• Confidence & Competitiveness:Your confidence shines through in customer interactions, making you a top performer in any sales environment
• Customer Engagement:You enjoy building relationships and making a difference in clients’ lives

Key Responsibilities:
• Exceed Sales Goals:Not just meet, but surpass your sales targets consistently
• Territory Travel:Visit customer homes within your assigned area to provide education on our exceptional products
• Strategic Negotiation:Leverage current promotions and affordability solutions to secure sales
• Empower Clients:Help customers transform their homes into their dream spaces!

Requirements:
• Education:Post-secondary education is preferred
• Driver’s License:A valid driver’s license and a reliable vehicle are essential
• Mobility:Must be willing to travel within your sales territory for in-home consultations
• Motivation:Self-motivated and capable of thriving in a work-from-home environment
• Availability:Evening hours and some Saturdays will be necessary to meet customer needs

Experience:
• Sales Background:3-5 years of commission-based sales experience is highly recommended

Why Lifestyle Home Products?

We celebrate diversity, collaboration, and respect within our team. Our culture encourages sharing ideas and supporting one another as we grow. We’re committed to a barrier-free recruitment process. If you require accommodations during the application process, please reach out tohr@lifestylehp.ca—we are here to help!

Seize the Opportunity!

Powered by JazzHR

En tant que Gestionnaire/Superviseur de comptabilité, vous serez responsable de la gestion des clôtures de fin de mois, de la préparation des états financiers et de la supervision des opérations comptables quotidiennes.Responsabilités:• Gérer le processus de clôture de fin de mois pour garantir la précision et l'efficacité• Préparer et présenter les états financiers conformément aux principes comptables généralement reconnus• Superviser les opérations comptables quotidiennes pour assurer le respect des politiques et des procédures internes• Réviser et améliorer les processus comptables pour une efficacité accrue• Collaborer avec d'autres départements pour soutenir les initiatives financières globales de l'entreprise• Maintenir une connaissance à jour des réglementations fiscales et des normes comptables pour garantir la conformité• Analyser les données financières et préparer les rapports financiers pour la direction• Fournir un soutien en matière de formation et de développement au personnel comptable pour favoriser la croissance professionnelle• Participer à divers projets spéciaux liés à la finance et à la comptabilité au besoin.

title: Airport Security Service Technician (Level 1, 2, and 3)
description:
Technicien de Service de Sécurité Aéroportuaire (niveaux 1, 2 et 3)

KPrime Technologies est dans une phase de croissance agressive et nous recherchons des personnes dynamiques pour se joindre à notre équipe à travers le Canada. Au cours de la dernière année, nous nous sommes concentrés sur l'embauche d'une équipe de 110 techniciens à travers le pays et nous en sommes à 75 %. Nous recherchons actuellement 3 nouveaux membres pour se joindre à notre équipe de 2, déjà à Québec. Celle-ci est composée d'un mélange de techniciens de différents niveaux travaillant en rotation pour soutenir cet aéroport et ses satellites, et nous voulons que vous en fassiez partie.

KPrime Technologies est une entreprise stimulante et florissante qui est le principal fournisseur indépendant de vente et de service d’instruments de détection de produits chimiques et de détecteurs pour la sécurité dans l'Ouest canadien, avec des ventes et un soutien actifs dans tout le Canada. Fondée en 1997, nous sommes fiers de notre histoire et de notre croissance, ainsi que de notre engagement envers la qualité et le service à la clientèle.

En tant que Technicien de Service de Sécurité Aéroportuaire, vous ferez partie d'une équipe assurant le service sur l'équipement de contrôle des passagers de l'Administration canadienne de la sûreté du transport aérien (ACSTA) à l'aéroport et ses satellites désignés. Cela comprend, sans s'y limiter, à l'installation, la réparation et l'entretien des systèmes de contrôle des passagers. L'entreprise vous fournira toute la formation spécifique, en classe et pratique, dont vous aurez besoin pour vous soutenir dans votre rôle. Nous recherchons des candidats qui possèdent une connaissance des compétences techniques en mécanique et en électronique, une expérience en réseau et en informatique, et qui sont fiers de produire des résultats de haute qualité.
• *Veuillez noter que nous publions pour une gamme de postes et que le niveau attribué aux candidats sera basé sur les compétences transférables et l'expérience.**

Principales responsabilités :
• Assurer le service, l'installation, la réparation et l'entretien de systèmes et équipements électriques/mécaniques
• Commander, recevoir et retourner des pièces selon les besoins
• Compléter la documentation et les rapports en temps opportun et de manière concise
• Assurer la liaison avec le personnel sur place et les partenaires de manière professionnelle
• Adhérer aux politiques de l'entreprise en matière de santé, de sécurité et de l’environnement

Qualifications et compétences requises :
• Diplôme d'une école technique, formation militaire en technologie du génie électronique et/ou certification professionnelle connexe
• Expérience dans un environnement de service sur le terrain et directement avec les technologies de rayons X, de dépistage et / ou connaissance des systèmes mécaniques complexes (très souhaitable)
• Service client proactif et de bout en bout (remplacer par tant) à l’interne et à l’externe
• De bonnes compétences en communication orale et écrite (la maîtrise de l'anglais est obligatoire. La maîtrise du français serait un atout)
• Connaissances en informatique et aptitude à apprendre des logiciels spécialisés
• Maîtrise des applications Microsoft et des systèmes d'exploitation (Windows, Linux)

Exigences physiques:
• La capacité de s'asseoir, de se tenir debout pendant de longues périodes, de marcher, de grimper, d'atteindre, de se pencher et de manœuvrer autour de l'équipement et des zones de travail est requise
• Soulever des charges jusqu'à 50 lb/23 kg
• "Bonnes mains", c'est-à-dire, maîtrise des outils manuels et électriques
• *Conditions non négociables d'emploi dans ce rôle : **
• Passer une vérification des antécédents de sécurité du gouvernement du Canada pour une autorisation de sécurité de haut niveau
• Être résident permanent du Canada, ou avoir vécu au moins 5 ans au Canada avec un visa de travail valide.
• Détenir un permis de conduire valide et avoir un accès fiable à un moyen de transport motorisé
• Détenir un passeport valide ou un visa de travail pour une formation aux États-Unis
• Avoir la capacité de travailler selon un horaire de travail irrégulier, incluant du travail par quarts et sur appel.
• Avoir la capacité de se rendre dans des aéroports éloignés pour l'entretien et les réparations d'urgence.
• Avoir la capacité de travailler sur des projets spéciaux de temps à autre et de voyager à court préavis au besoin.

Avantages :
• Une échelle salariale de 45 000 $ à 85 000 $ par an en fonction du niveau de départ (1,2,3) avec augmentation en fonction du développement des compétences à travers la formation
• Ensemble complet d'avantages

•Congés payés

Additional Posting Information (the terms they use on indeed may be slightly different, so this is just for reference)

Type d'emploi : Temps plein

Emploi: égalité des chances en matière d'emploi

Considérations liées à la COVID-19 : Tous les employés doivent être complètement vaccinés contre la COVID-19. Transports Canada l'exige.

Type d'emploi : Temps plein

Salaire : 45 000,00 $ à 85 000,00 $ par année

Avantages:
• Soins dentaires
• Assurance invalidité
• Soins de santé complémentaires
• Congés payés
• Soins de la vue

Horaire:
• Quart de jour
• Quart du soir
• Quart de nuit
• Du lundi au vendredi
• Disponibilité le week-end

Considérations liées à la COVID-19 :

Tous les employés doivent être complètement vaccinés contre le Covid-19. Transports Canada l'exige.

Airport Security Service Technician (Level 1, 2, and 3)

KPrime Technologies is a vibrant and thriving company that is the foremost independent sales & service provider for chemical and security detection instruments in Western Canada with active sales and support throughout Canada. Established in 1997, we take pride in our history and growth, as well as our commitment to quality and customer service.

As an Airport Security Service Technician, you will be a part of a team providing service on The Canadian Air Transport Security Authority’s (CATSA) passenger screening equipment at airports across Canada. This includes service such as the installation, repair, and maintenance of passenger screening systems. Specific and complete in-class and hands-on training will be provided to support you in your role. The ideal candidate will possess a base knowledge of mechanical/electronics technical skills and take pride in putting out high quality workmanship.

Please note this is a range posting, and level will be based on experience. Candidates that meet all the position requirements will be given first consideration however we invite all interested candidates to submit their applications.

Primary Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
• Provide service, installation, repair and maintenance of electrical/mechanical systems and equipment
• Order, receive and return parts as required
• Complete documentation and reports in a timely and concise manner
• Liaise with on-site staff and partners in a professional manner
• Adhere to company health, safety, and environmental policies

Education/Skills Requirements:
• Graduate of technical school, military training in electronics engineering technology, and/or related trade certification required
• Experience in a field service environment with direct experience in x-ray, screening technologies, and/or knowledge of complex mechanical systems is highly desirable
• Computer literacy and aptitude for learning specialized software programs
• Motivated, self-starter with strong communication skills (English Fluency is mandatory. French fluency would be an asset)
• Excellent customer interface and communication skills, both verbal and written are required
• Proficiency in Microsoft Applications and Operating Systems
• Fluency in English and French (oral and written) would be considered an asset.

Physical Requirements:
• Possess strong hands-on abilities, manual dexterity, physical strength, and stamina
• Capability to sit, stand for prolonged periods, walk, climb, reach, bend and maneuver around equipment and work areas is required
• Some lifting of weight up to 50 lbs / 23 kgs

Additionally, to qualify and be considered for this employment, you must:
• Pass a Government of Canada security background checks for high level security clearance
• Be legally authorized to work in Canada indefinitely
• Hold a valid driver's license and reliable access to motor vehicle transportation
• Hold a valid passport and currently be eligible to travel to the United States
• Have the ability to work an irregular work schedule, which involves shift work and on-call duties
• Have the ability to travel to remote airport locations for maintenance and emergency repairs.
• Have the ability to work on special projects from time to time and travel on short notice as required.

What KPrime Offers:

· An entrance salary range of $45,000 to $85,000 per year with increase in line with advancement of skills through training

· Comprehensive benefits package

· Paid Vacation

What you will gain:

· You will gain skill and experience through training and utilizing the latest generation of mobile worker technology including apps from Microsoft Dynamics and headsets from Realwear

Job Type: Full-Time

Employment: Equal Employment Opportunity

COVID-19 Considerations: All employees must be fully vaccinated against Covid-19. Transport Canada requires this.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45,000.00-$85,000.00 per year

Benefits:
• Dental care
• Extended health care
• Paid time off
• RRSP match
• Vision care

Schedule:
• Day shift
• Evening shift
• Monday to Friday
• Weekends as needed

Application question(s):
• Are you able to work shift work (days/nights/weekends) ?
• Are you able to pass a Government of Canada security background check for high level security clearance?
• Do you hold a valid driver's license and have reliable access to motor vehicle transportation?
• Have you been vaccinated against Covid-19?
• Are you legally authorized to work in Canada?
• Do you hold a valid passport? Are you currently eligible to travel to the US?

Work Location: In person

title: Field Service Technician II - Montreal - French Speaking
description:
Leica Biosystems’ mission of “Advancing Cancer Diagnostics, Improving Lives” is at the heart of our corporate culture. We’re a global leader in cancer diagnostics with the most comprehensive portfolio from biopsy to diagnosis. Our easy-to-use and consistently reliable offerings help improve workflow efficiency and diagnostic confidence. Our associates know that every moment matters when it comes to cancer diagnostics. When you come to work, you’re helping develop solutions that enable accurate diagnoses to turn anxiety into answers. Join our diverse, global team of talented people, and be inspired to grow every day.

Leica Biosystems is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Diagnostics Companies at Danaher. Together, we’re working at the pace of change to improve patient lives with diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges.

The Field Service Engineer II for Leica Biosystems is responsible for supporting the needs of our customers, which directly impacts patient health and overall well-being.

This position is part of the Service Organization located in Seattle, WA. At Leica Biosystems, our vision is to advance cancer diagnostics and improve lives.

You will be a part of the Field Service Team and report to the Regional Field Service Manager responsible for troubleshooting, installation, preventative maintenance, and service repair needs. If you thrive in a fast-paced role and want to work to build a world-class service organization—read on.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to:

• Provide installation support, maintenance, modification and/or repair on 1-2 groups of mechanical, electromechanical, electronic and/or refrigeration instruments.

• Document and complete service administration activities in a timely manner to follow ISO, FDA, and Leica policies.

• Actively support the sale of service contracts, assist sales representatives & service team members with system configurations/upgrades, and provide feedback on ways to improve financial performance to generate service revenue

The essential requirements of the job include:
• Associates Degree with 3+ years of technical experience OR 5+ years of equivalent technical work experience. Bachelor’s Degree preferred.
• Bilingual English and French

Travel, Motor Vehicle Record & Physical/Environment Requirements: if applicable for role
• Ability to travel – up to 90%, including frequent overnights
• Must have a valid driver’s license with an acceptable driving record
• Ability to lift, move or carry equipment up to 50 lb.

It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:

• Diagnosing and repairing medical devices, electromechanical equipment, or scientific instruments.
• Field Service Engineering and/or Networking/IT system upgrades.
• A lab or hospital environment.

At Leica Biosystems we believe in designing a better, more sustainable workforce. We recognize the benefits of flexible, remote working arrangements for eligible roles and are committed to providing enriching careers, no matter the work arrangement. This position is eligible for a remote work arrangement in which you can work remotely from your home. Additional information about this remote work arrangement will be provided by your interview team. Explore the flexibility and challenge that working for Leica Biosystems can provide.

The salary range for this role is $65,000-$85,000. This is the range that we in good faith believe is the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future.

This job is also eligible for bonus/incentive pay.

We offer comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.

Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.

Bilingual Candidate Required.

At Danaher we bring together science, technology and operational capabilities to accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life. Our global teams are pioneering what’s next across Life Sciences, Diagnostics, Biotechnology and beyond. For more information, visit www.danaher.com.

At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

title: Service Technician - Part Time
description:
A bit about us

Trek is an awesome place to work, with amazing benefits for all employees. We build only products we love, provide incredible hospitality to our customers, and change the world by getting more people on bikes. When you’re on our team, you’re taken care of, encouraged to learn and grow, and given lots of opportunities to do so. Give us your best, and we’ll give it right back. Sound pretty sweet? Then come join us!

Job Location

Trek Store Plateau Mont-Royal

Job Description

As a Trek Service Technician, no one day is the same as the last. This job is all about caring for bikes so their owners love riding them. You’ll troubleshoot repairs and service all kinds of bikes, and you’ll be the first to have your hands on brand new models before they hit the sales floor. Most importantly, you’ll build relationships with people who trust you to keep their gear running flawlessly.

We’re looking for a teammate with stellar customer service chops, a willingness to learn, and a real motivation to build skills as a technician. So, if you’ve already worked as a mechanic, that’s great. But if not, we’ll train you.

What you’ll bring to the team
• Self-motivation, a positive, team-focused mentality, plus a willingness to pitch in on any task
• Fantastic hospitality—a warm, approachable manner, great listening skills, and a drive to help in any way you can—even on the toughest, busiest days
• Top-notch communication skills
• Impressive attention to detail and a love for tinkering ‘til you figure it out.
• Eagerness to learn the ins and outs of servicing bicycles
• A desire to continually learn proper service methods and new technologies
• Prior mechanic experience is not required!

Trek Benefits:
• Flexible and fun company culture
• Supplemental health care
• Dental insurance, Vision insurance
• Free Life insurance & optional term life insurance
• Competitive vacation package
• RRSP matching plan
• 12 weeks of maternity leave with 100% pay
• Flexible holiday schedule – 9 statutory holidays
• Employee discounts on all product

title: Sales Representative | Fairview (Full Time)
description:
Description

What does it mean to join our TELUS family?
• Our goal is to provide Canadians with an excellent experience, by connecting with our customers and meeting all their needs under one roof
• We are passionate about people - our customers, our communities, and our team
• We work tirelessly in our stores to provide best in class service to our customers, and in our communities to enrich the lives of Canadians with all acts of kindness - big and small
• We strive to ensure you have the support and resources you need to be successful at work and at home
• We offer the opportunity to work with all of our brands

As a Team Member in our stores, you can expect to:
• Be part of a high performing team where your contributions are measured and recognized
• Create solutions for our customers by using the power of technology to improve their lives
• Work in a fast paced environment, where every day is different
• Engage with prospective and current customers in store, by phone and messaging
• Work a flexible schedule, which includes evenings and weekends

What’s in it for you?
• Uncapped commission so your earning potential is limitless
• Flexible benefits plan to meet the needs of you and your family; part-time and full-time employees are eligible
• Additional sales incentives like cash prizes, phones, accessories, and trips
• Career growth and learning & development opportunities to continuously develop your skills
• Opportunity to give back to communities in which we work, live and serve
• Options for company matched pension and share purchase programs
• WorkPerks - employee discounts on products and services
• And much more…

title: Senior Electrical Engineer - Buildings
description:
Titre : Ingénieur Électrique Senior

Statut : Permanent, Temps Plein

Salaire : 115 000 à 140 000 $ selon l'expérience, 4 semaines de vacances, avantages sociaux, fonds de pension

Lieu : Centre-ville de Montréal, Québec - Hybride 3 jours au bureau

Notre client est une entreprise privée d'ingénierie de premier plan avec des bureaux à travers le Canada. Fondée en 1919 et comptant plus de 400 employés, elle est un partenaire de confiance pour certains des plus grands projets de construction au Canada.

Responsabilités :
• Apporter la contribution individuelle d’un·e professionnel·le chevronné·e
• Élaborer des conceptions techniques pour une grande diversité de projets qui peuvent présenter une complexité technique, avoir une valeur élevée et demander de nombreux corps de métier
• Créer de manière indépendante des dessins conceptuels et des devis de conception, et évaluer la constructibilité sur une base régulière
• Élaborer de manière indépendante des normes et des rapports, et les approuver.
• Contribuer à l’élaboration des plans de projet, participer aux réunions de planification et de gestion de projet et formuler des recommandations d’amélioration afin de garantir le respect des produits livrables et des échéanciers
• Examiner le travail d’ingénieurs juniors dans le cadre de projets conventionnels.
• Effectuer son propre travail dans les heures prévues au budget
• Assumer la responsabilité de tous les champs de conception jusqu’à l’achèvement des travaux de construction
• Travailler de manière autonome à la résolution de problèmes difficiles et parfois complexes.
• Superviser les travaux de construction sur les chantiers
• Autres responsabilités, selon les besoins

Qualifications :
• Diplôme universitaire en génie électrique
• 10 ans ou plus d’expérience dans le domaine du génie-conseil
• Membre agréé-e der l’OIQ
• Parfaitement bilingue - francais obligatoire
• Bonne connaissance d’AutoCAD et de Revit
• Pensée avant-gardiste avec le désir d’apprendre les pratiques exemplaires et de contribuer aux idées novatrices
• Bonnes aptitudes à la production de documents et à la précision
• Capacité à collaborer et travailler efficacement avec différentes équipes, y compris des équipes multidisciplinaires
• Passionnée par les bâtiments et l’environnement bâti

Nous remercions tous ceux qui postulent, cependant, seuls ceux qui répondent à tous les critères seront contactés. Pour plus d'informations sur nos services de recrutement, veuillez visiter www.groomassocies.com.

title: Inside Sales Consultant
description:
Manulife Investment Management (MIM) Advisor Group delivers financial and investment solutions and advice, including financial planning and insurance, to clients across the wealth spectrum.

The Inside Sales Consultant, being a Transition Consultant, is an important role in the MIM Advisor Group. The Consultant connects with employees in our group plans at Manulife at a time when they are transitioning away from their current employer to understand their investment and other needs so that they may guide and assist them with respect to their plans going forward.

Position Responsibilities:
• Conduct one-on-one needs-based conversations over the phone for group retirement plan-members currently enrolled in an employer group plan
• Educate and communicate value proposition on benefits of various options for members
• Conduct financial illustrations for plan members around drawing retirement income
• Guide members through need-based analysis and formulate a plan of action and related suitability for immediate assets that are in group plan
• By understanding client preferences and their personal situation, identify referral opportunities

Required Qualifications:
• Minimum 1 year in client facing roles in the financial industry, preferability wealth or asset management
• Post-Secondary Education is an asset
• Life License (LLQP) required by start date
• Mutual Fund License (MFDA) is preferred

Preferred Qualifications:
• Demonstrated ability to articulate value proposition through consultation over the phone
• Possess active listening skills to understand the clients’ needs and personal situation
• Attention to detail in gathering and accurately recording all customer information
• High degree of integrity putting the client at the center of the conversation
• Strong compliance approach
• Remain current and up to date on our products and services, as well as processes
• The successful candidate will be required to communicate in English and French in order to support clients from various jurisdictions outside of Quebec.

Bilingual (French & English) is required - The successful candidate will be required to communicate in English and French to support clients from various jurisdictions outside of Quebec.

When you join our team:
• We’ll empower you to learn and grow the career you want.
• We’ll recognize and support you in a flexible environment where well-being and inclusion are more than just words.
• As part of our global team, we’ll support you in shaping the future you want to see.

About Manulife and John Hancock

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services provider, helping people make their decisions easier and lives better. To learn more about us, visit https://www.manulife.com/en/about/our-story.html.

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com.

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Salary & Benefits

Salary will vary depending on local market conditions, geography and relevant job-related factors such as knowledge, skills, qualifications, experience, and education/training. Employees also have the opportunity to participate in incentive programs and earn incentive compensation tied to business and individual performance. Please contact recruitment@manulife.com for additional information.

Manulife offers eligible employees a wide array of customizable benefits, including health, dental, mental health, vision, short- and long-term disability, life and AD&D insurance coverage, adoption/surrogacy and wellness benefits, and employee/family assistance plans. We also offer eligible employees various retirement savings plans (including pension and a global share ownership plan with employer matching contributions) and financial education and counseling resources. Our generous paid time off program in Canada includes holidays, vacation, personal, and sick days, and we offer the full range of statutory leaves of absence. If you are applying for this role in the U.S., please contact recruitment@manulife.com for more information about U.S.-specific paid time off provisions.

title: Financial Analyst, US ABL Lender Consulting Group
Program Finance Analyst
description:
About your next Challenge as a Program Finance Analyst

L3Harris MAPPS is seeking an experienced program finance analyst who will be responsible for the financial control of large programs. The incumbent will work as a key business partner to Program Managers and functional teams to establish and maintain the program’s financial plan, perform analyses and prepare reports in order to ensure that contracts are within negotiated and agreed-upon parameters and cost control guidelines. The incumbent will coordinate program level preparation and maintenance of financial forecasts, including orders, sales, operating income and cash for the Monthly Forecast Review (MFR). The incumbent will work well in a team environment, learn how to manage time efficiently, and able to work on multiple programs at the same time with attention to detail as the employee presents his/her analysis in a fast paced, deadline driven environment.

What will you do:
• Development/review of time-phased budgets following contract award
• Tracking, monitoring, and analyzing cost performance on programs
• Ongoing reporting of Program(s) cost and schedule variances in accordance with company policy
• ETC/EAC preparation and review, analysis and monitoring
• Maintenance and reporting of timely performance data to division management team as well as customer
• Prepare milestone schedule/invoices and analyze program cash forecast
• Generating monthly earned value metrics for assigned program(s)
• Providing financial analysis for audits and other financial activities
• Ad Hoc/Other duties as assigned by leadership

Required Skills and Experiences:
• Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting;
• 3-5 years of experience in an accounting / finance role
• Strong Knowledge in Microsoft Office Software;
• Strong analytical skills;
• Highly organized and ability to manage multiple priorities;
• Knowledge of SAP an asset;
• Detailed oriented with strong accounting and finance skills
• Focused on teamwork and collaboration;
• Excellent communication skills both oral and written French & English proficiency.

Eligibility Criteria (Mandatory):
• Must be eligible for registration with the Controlled Goods Program;
• Must be eligible to obtain and maintain a government of Canada Reliability status and Secret Level 2/NATO SECRET security clearance.
• Must be eligible to meet the requirements for U.S. International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR).

title: Senior Financial Analyst - FP&A and Commercial Finance
description:
ABOUT US

Family-owned and operated since 1953, Lamour Inc. has earned its reputation as the “Best in Class” choice for socks, performance wear, hosiery and intimates. In fact, we are among the top 5 global players in base layer active wear, the #1 global seamless manufacturer, & one of Canada’s leading sock manufacturers. As a one-stop shop, we work innovatively and passionately to deliver outstanding quality and value to a diversified international customer base. It is our focus on performance fabric technology and product innovation, investment in manufacturing excellence, speed to market, and supply chain execution that allows us to build meaning, strong, and long-lasting retail partnerships across multiple trade channels.

WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR

Reporting to the SVP of Finance, the Senior Financial Analyst will oversee the company’s Financial Planning and Analysis and Commercial Finance function. This role is responsible for preparing the annual budget, forecasts, and business plans, as well as conducting monthly business reviews, including variance analysis and KPI assessments. The Senior Financial Analyst will provide financial insights, support strategic initiatives, and develop financial models to support strategic decision-making. This role requires strong collaboration with business units and the accounting team to optimize financial performance and support company-wide objectives.

DUTIES INCLUDE (BUT NOT LIMITED TO)
• Lead the Company’s Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) process and function
• Prepare the Company’s annual budget, forecasts, and business plans
• Conduct the Company’s monthly business review, including variance analysis and assess key performance indicators to identify trends and areas for improvement
• Prepare summary reports and analyses to provide financial insights, support strategic initiatives, and evaluate potential business opportunities
• Prepare and maintain financial models and forecasts to support strategic decision-making
• Support the implementation of initiatives and special projects through financial and operational data analysis
• Analyze financial and operational data to identify trends and provide insights to business leaders
• Collaborate with business units to create and analyze budgets, providing insights and recommendations to optimize financial performance
• Partner with the accounting team and cross-functional business leaders

REQUIRMENTS
• Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field
• 3+ years of FP&A experience, demonstrating a track record of successfully supporting organizational growth
• 2-3 years in Audit or M&A in a major Accounting firm, a strong plus
• CPA designation
• MBA or relevant advanced degree, a plus
• Strong business and financial acumen and ability to work with large data sets
• Strong financial modeling and analytical skills, with a focus on forecasting and budgeting
• Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex financial concepts
• Proficient in financial planning software and advanced Microsoft Excel skills
• Detail oriented with the ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment

WHAT WE OFFER
• 100% off public transport;
• Flexible work hours Fridays we finish at 4:00 pm (1:30PM in the summer!!);
• Tim Hortons gift card on your birthday;
• Rooftop terrace
• Company events and celebrations;
• Monthly team bonding activities;
• Free gym access (yoga, bootcamp, kickboxing included);
• Medical and dental benefits.. and much much more!

title: International Project and Operations Manager
description:
About Us

At Econoler, we are proud to be certified Great Place to Work! Having completed over 6,000 projects in Canada and internationally, we have been leaders in energy efficiency and the fight against climate change for over 40 years. Our talented and inspiring team is at the heart of our success. Join us to make a meaningful impact and be part of a passionate and bold team!

What you will do

Econoler’s International Group is looking for an inspiring leader ready to take charge, guide project teams, and foster collaboration in support of our mission to drive the global energy transition. Focused on international energy efficiency and climate mitigation initiatives, we value strategic thinkers and collaborative team builders who thrive in fast-paced environments.

As an International Project and Operations Manager, you will oversee a variety of consulting projects, ensuring operational excellence and team success. Your expertise in managing budgets, timelines, and implementing efficient project management processes, combined with your ability to supervise experts and contribute to team development, will be critical in delivering impactful results for our international clients and partners. Strong organizational skills and clear communication will be at the core of your success in this role.

You Will Have The Opportunity To

People Management
• Supervise professionals across various levels (engineering, finance, economics), monitoring their workload and maintaining regular communication to foster performance.
• Cultivate a positive, collaborative, and productive team culture aligned with company values.
• Conduct regular 1:1 meetings to track team well-being, performance and development.
• Address performance and/or behavioural issues promptly, directly, and decisively to maintain team cohesion and standards.
• Develop and monitor training and career progression plans for team members in collaboration with group leadership and HR.

Project Management
• Take charge of project management responsibilities for international consulting projects of varying scope and complexity.
• Monitor project budgets, timelines, and deliverables to ensure successful outcomes and maintain quality standards.
• Establish, optimize, and uphold project management standards for the international group providing training and continuous updates.
• Offer expertise and support to team members across diverse projects as needed.

Operation Management
• Support team productivity by optimizing resources (human, financial, material, informational) and coordinating with other departments.
• Collaborate with leadership to define effective goals, performance metrics (KPIs), training initiatives, and monitor progress.
• Oversee team workflows to optimize workload balance and maintain alignment with budgets, timelines, and deliverables.
• Guide and support team members in applying established processes, procedures, and tools.
• Identify opportunities and innovative process improvements and updates to enhance overall operations.

What we are looking for

Education
• Bachelor’s degree in engineering, business administration, international relations, management, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
• A master’s degree is an asset.

Experience
• Minimum 10 years of professional experience, including at least 5 years in consulting.
• Proven experience managing international, multidisciplinary teams at varying seniority levels.
• Proven experience in managing international consulting projects

Knowledge
• Proficiency in MS365 tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Teams).
• Fluency in French and English; Spanish is an asset.
• Familiarity with energy transition, climate change mitigation and/or engineering concepts is an asset.

Location:
• Ideally based in Quebec City or within driving/commuting distance.
• Willingness to come to the Quebec office on a weekly basis for the first 6 months minimally.

What we offer

The well-being and development of our employees are essential to our success, and we are pleased to offer:
• Flexible working hours
• Flexible work locations – From our offices in Quebec City and Montreal, as well as options for remote work
• Internal growth opportunities
• Ongoing training tailored to your professional aspirations and needs
• Flexible vacation
• Holiday break
• 50% reimbursement of public transit passes
• Modular insurance plan with employer contribution
• Telemedicine
• RRSP with employer contribution
• Active social club

Econoler is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all our employees.

Please note that only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Operations Manager Sudbury
description:
Job Purpose

Reporting to the Director of Operations, you will be responsible for managing the Project Management Center (PMF) operations planning to achieve and exceed the objectives set by the senior management.

title: Associate, Private Client
description:
Associate, Private Client

Davies is a leading Canadian business law firm focused on high-stakes matters. Tackling their clients' issues with clarity and efficiency, they are at the heart of the most complex deals and cases. With offices in Toronto, Montréal and New York, the firm's capabilities extend across borders.

The firm is now seeking a trusts and estate planning lawyer with 3+ years of comparable experience to join its Private Client team. Today's high-net-worth individuals and family offices face increasing complexities when planning for the preservation, transfer and expansion of wealth, often in a cross-border or international context. Clients rely on Davies to provide creative, customized trusts, tax and estate planning advice to address structurally complex and personally sensitive matters.

In this role you will undertake challenging work advising high-net-worth private individuals, family offices and private companies on strategic matters including all types of private wealth trusts, commercial trusts, estate planning structures, structures to effect charitable and philanthropic giving, trusts and fiduciary arrangements. We are looking for a candidate with experience in a high-calibre private client, family office and/or trusts and estate practice acquired at a national law firm, accounting firm or specialized boutique law firm. The right candidate has a commitment to exceeding client expectations, enjoys intellectual challenges and finding creative solutions for clients, as well as the ability to efficiently manage multiple projects simultaneously. Professionalism, excellent written and oral communication skills, judgment and diplomacy will be essential. We are looking for someone with the following qualifications:
• Experience structuring and drafting trusts, wills and powers of attorney
• Experience with reorganizations undertaken for strategic tax and succession planning purposes
• Familiarity with cross-border issues and post-mortem estate and tax planning is an asset
• Candidates must be a member of the Québec bar; STEP membership will be considered an asset

In return, you will receive strong mentorship and support and gain exposure to high-end work to develop your skills and expertise in this space. You will be part of the highly collaborative team from day one.

To apply, please email your resumé and cover letter to Nanci Ship, Chief Legal Talent and Culture Officer, at nship@dwpv.com.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. Davies Ward Phillips & Vineberg LLP is committed to providing a work environment that is diverse, inclusive and accessible to applicants and firm members with disabilities. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please let us know.
