title: Product Manager, Virtual Care
description:
Vention helps some of the most innovative manufacturing companies automate their production floor in just a few days. Vention's online-first manufacturing automation platform (MAP) enables its clients to design, automate, order, and deploy manufacturing equipment directly from their web browser.

Vention is headquartered in Montreal, Canada, with offices in Berlin and Boston, and is used in over 3,000 factories on 5 continents. As one of Canada’s Most Admired Cultures and Great Place to Work , we are a performance driven culture that cares deeply about happiness. We like ambitious goals, facts & data, and constructive debates. But at the same time, we know that we can’t repeatedly push ourselves if we are not surrounded by an uplifting and caring work environment. Those two sides of our culture, feed each other and are safeguarded with the same level of attention. We innovate to inspire - we value innovation in products, user experiences, and business practices.

As the Product Manager for the Web platform, you will own the product roadmap for Vention’s transactional website, the user community infrastructure, and private client portals. In this role, you will interface with clients to capture emerging needs, drive respective software development teams. Leveraging your product management expertise, you will be uniquely positioned to guide architectural choices and drive effective prioritization of our effort and resources. Conduct analysis to inform new product specifications and evaluate performance of existing products

Prepare detailed brief for new software/features, including business logic

Develop sales enablement material and train various go-to market teams (Account Executive, Application Engineers, Customer Success, etc.)

Align with marketing and the product designers to keep a unify artistic direction for the website

Prepare and host sprint kick-off, ensuring software team support the scope and can successfully define the "how"

Ensure deadline compliance for each feature/product and measure team performance

Conduct business QA on new products/features to ensure the user experience contribute to elevating the Vention platform

Work with software team and HR to ensure teams are properly staffed with expertise required to deliver the annual roadmap

Bachelor's degree in business or other relevant field
• 5 years experience in product management for global e-commerce and marketplace platforms,
• Experience with multi-language and multi-currency transactional capabilities
• Strong analytical tool kit with ability to run complex analysis including regression, T-sample tests, A/B tests
• Strong project management and risk mitigation mindset, with demonstrated ability to build contingency plan and execute them
• Flexible paid time off and remote work policies

Complimentary beverages and snacks so that you are fueled and ready for your day

Fun-filled social events curated based on diverse interests for our team to celebrate together. From sponsored sports teams to trivia nights

Time off to volunteer and give back to your community.

The fast-paced, high-performance environment will give you the opportunity to build products, processes and strategies that will have a lasting impact.

We’re passionate about helping you do your best work. Claim your seat and find out what you can do!

We are happy to chat and get to know you better while you can understand the role as well.

title: Merchandising Assistant
description:
WHO WE ARE ?

Psycho Bunny is a worldwide menswear brand that had one mission when it was founded in New York back in 2005: to perfect the polo. Nearly two decades later, our quality-obsessed approach has built a devoted following of fashion-conscious individuals looking for exceptional-quality everyday staples that command attention—while remaining unconventional and daring. Today, color-driven collections extend to Pima cotton T-shirts, plush French terry sweats, versatile bottoms, elevated outerwear, need-to-have accessories, and a myriad of perfected polos. are reimagined for each drop, of which there are approximately 13 every year. Our global expansion in the fashion landscape is attributed to the eclectic personalities who have joined our ranks, making Psycho Bunny the creative community it is today—and will be tomorrow.

WHY JOIN THE TEAM ?

This isn’t your typical workplace. Your voice will be heard. You’ll matter. And you’ll be instrumental in our unique brand’s ascent to new heights. Our rapid global expansion requires fluidity in an ever-changing high-performance environment. You’ll have the opportunity to learn, grow, and constantly expand your skill set. We’re looking for forward-thinkers who want to take ownership and drive change. As the company forges to scale exception growth, you’re presented with the opportunity to get involved and make a meaningful impact. If all this sounds appealing, we’d love to meet you!

WHAT IS THE ROLE ?

Reporting to the Senior Product Manager or Product Manager, the Merchandise Assistant will be responsible for participating in assisting the product manager in all aspects surrounding the creation of seasonal product assortments. Supporting the merchandising functions and everyday tasks.

HOW WILL YOU DO IT?
• Partner with the product manager to build the seasonal product assortment.
• Own the sample management of all in-season product samples.
• Partners and manages seasonal product worksheets and collaborates with cross functional teams (design, wholesale,..) to ensure accuracy.
• Partners with the product manager in creating/maintaining the assortment plan.
• Assist product manager in various daily tasks (analysis, process improvements, etc..).
• Partner with the product manager to analyze weekly sales and business trends, and help identify areas of opportunity to positively impact the business.
• Analyze competition/market for new emerging trends, competitor product landscape and pricing comparables (quarterly competition report) relevant to psycho bunny.
• Support key meetings through document preparation, sample preparation (etc..) to ensure deadlines are met.
• Drive cross functional communication and build cross functional partnerships to ensure team alignment and follow ups (retail and wholesale division).

WHO YOU ARE ?

Your achievements
• DEC, Bachelor’s or Fashion Merchandising Diploma (or equivalent preferred).
• 1-2 years of experience in a related position, preferably in Fashion Retail.
• Strong knowledge: MS Excel and Google Applications. Power BI considered a plus.
• Strong fashion sense/brand vision

Your contribution
• Roll up your sleeve mindset who is solution oriented.
• Self starter that shows initiative, dedication and commitment to the brand.
• Analytical and detail-oriented.
• Strong problem-solving abilities.
• Strong organizational and multitasking skills to adapt to an ever-changing environment.
• Demonstrates agility and is able to adapt to changing priorities.
• Effective written and verbal communication skills, in English and French.
• Have an eye for trending and emerging products.

WHAT WE OFFER

You’ll have an entire team in your corner, ensuring that you are seen, heard, respected, and treated the way you want to be treated. That includes access to our employee benefits:
• Group Insurance coverage, including health, dental, vision, Life, and long-term disability.
• Psycho Bunny offers all Canadian employees the possibility to participate in a group RRSP/DPSP plan which includes a very generous match from Psycho Bunny!
• An Employee /Family Assistance Program (EFAP).
• Casual dress code.
• Company events and social hours.
• On-site gym.
• On-site cafeteria/bistro with subsidized meals, breakfast, and lunch.
• Three (3) weeks of vacation.
• Six (6) wellness days.
• On-site parking, including electric car chargers.
• Your birthday off on us.
• Last but not least, let us not forget the swag you can get with an amazing employee discount!

At Psycho Bunny, we believe in the power of face-to-face interaction and the energy of our on-site work environment. We also recognize the importance of flexibility in today's dynamic world. Employees have the option to work remotely on occasions when personal or professional circumstances require it while still maintaining our strong culture of in-person collaboration and innovation.

We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Field Service Technician - Laser & Automation
description: How brave are you? We are a high-tech company providing machine tools and laser technology, and are looking for people who can face new challenges with a fresh mind. As an independent family company, we offer you the freedom and trust to put your brave ideas into practice. With you on board, we would like to power ahead with the digital networking of the manufacturing industry. Our passion and creative drive ensure that we are an innovative force - across the globe at over 70 TRUMPF locations. Field Service Technician is responsible for installing, demonstrating, maintaining and troubleshooting TRUMPF CNC machines for the TRUMPF Machine Tool division, Laser machines as well as connected Automation and Storage Systems) with minimum assistance. Field Service Responsibilities - Install, maintain, troubleshoot, and repair TRUMPF equipment with high quality - Demonstration and Train customers in use and repair of TRUMPF machines in a complete and organized manner. - Travel up to 100%. Travel includes regional, national and international travel. - Complete basic retrofits, software installations and customer training - Troubleshoot and remedy complex issues - Work independently to resolve technical problems and maintain good relationship to customers - Use relevant electrical measuring tools efficiently for trouble shooting - Submit required weekly TRUMPF reports in a complete and organized manner. - Assist other Field Engineers as directed. - Participate in training lasting approximately 6 months with on-going training on existing and new products each year. - Must be able to lift 70 pounds without aid. Travel Requirements - Must be located, or ability to relocate, within 45 minutes of a major International Airport - 100% travel required, both internationally and domestically - Perform extensive travel as needed, including but not limited to Monday through Friday - Some weekend work as needed. Experience/Education - Two-years technical school degree in Engineering principles or a suitable combination of education and work experience. Also, experience in computer software/file management is of advantage. - 2 or more years of experience in technical service, field service, repair or customer service required - Strong electrical and computer systems experience and high level of diagnostic skills - Previous experience with robotics, lasers, automation systems or mechatronics. - Previous experience with hand tools and measurement tools - Must have strong problem-solving and excellent organization skills We look forward to seeing your resume!

title: Field Service Mechanic
description:
We are currently hiring Field Service Technicians (Mechanics) to join our growing team!

Crown Lift Trucks is the premier material handling dealer in Canada. We are a leader in the industry and are considered a one-stop shop for all material handling needs. Crown Lift Trucks Canada operates eight full-service branches in both Ontario and Quebec offering complete service solutions including maintenance programs, parts supply, and training.

Ideally you are an electromechanic, an automotive, heavy equipment, truck and coach, or power lift truck technician, or are enrolled in a motive power program. Candidates with similar mechanical experience are also considered for this role. You are a results-orientated self-starter and team player, with strong communication and customer service skills.

The position requires traveling in the region around Laval, Mascouche, Terrebonne and St-Eustache.

Perks and Benefits
• Competitive compensation, no flat rate
• Monday-Friday, daytime hours
• Yearly tool allowance
• Tuition reimbursement for any program or course of your choice
• Comprehensive benefits such as: medical insurance, dental, vision, long term/short term disability, life insurance, and more
• Pension plan
• Boot allowance
• A provided service van with gas, insurance, and repair expenses covered
• Company provided cellphone
• Opportunities for advancement and ongoing professional development
• State-of-the-art training facilities

The Role

Reporting to the Field Service Manager, Field Service Technicians are responsible for driving to customer locations and troubleshooting, servicing, and repairing both Crown and competitors' lift trucks and other equipment.
• Discuss with customer and review recommended repairs. Estimate or quote repair costs. Place parts orders and complete necessary paperwork
• Perform safety and operational tests
• Perform pre-delivery inspections, lay down trucks, and install trucks as needed
• Communicate customer satisfaction information and leads to the appropriate personnel
• Complete all training as required
• Perform other duties as assigned

Physical Requirements
• Able to safely operate lift trucks and vehicles/service vans
• Able to sit, stand, walk, bend/stoop/twist, squat, reach below knee level, grip/grasp, work with arm outstretched, and work above chest level
• Able to lift/carry/push/pull up to 50 lbs.
• Able to occasionally lift/carry/push/pull up to 100 lbs., reach above shoulder level, climb stairs, climb ladders, torque, use vibratory tools, and pinch grip

Education and Qualifications
• High school diploma
• Valid driver’s license
• Industry related training and/or one to two years of prior experience (preferred)
• Able to read and understand hydraulic and electrical schematics
• Familiar with tools and equipment such as common hand tools, electrical/air tools, torch, arc welder, and various types of testing equipment
• Able to read and understand service manuals and microfiche, plan and follow-through
• Good organizational, customer service, communication and interpersonal skills required

Please note that we require all new hires to complete a criminal reference check to be eligible for employment.

We are an equal opportunity employer.

title: Instrumentation Technician – Field
description:
Dynatherm Instrumentation is a company specializing in instrumentation and control. We are currently seeking a candidate to join our team. The instrumentation technician will work with other technicians to ensure the proper functioning of equipment at our client’s sites.
Qualifications and Required Skills
• College degree (DEC) in instrumentation and control or an equivalent qualification
• Minimum of 1 to 3 years of experience in instrumentation, calibration service, or a similar role
• Experience in tolerance definition and validation
• Experience with calibration and/or communication equipment
• Excellent problem-solving skills
• Proficiency with basic Microsoft Office software
• Knowledge of Met/Team and Met/Cal software (asset)
• Valid driver’s license in Quebec
• Fluent in both French and English, spoken and written
• Canadian citizen or authorized to work in Canada
Job Responsibilities
• Apply calibration methods and validate measurement instruments, including temperature, flow meters, pressure, level systems, humidity, pH, conductivity, voltage, current, etc.
• Perform calibration of turbine engine test benches
• Calibrate thermal treatment ovens according to the AMS-2750 standard
• Follow procedures of our ISO-17025 quality system
• Provide technical support to production by responding to service calls at client sites
• Contribute to the improvement of the calibration program
• Develop expertise to offer technical advice and consultations to clients
Work Schedule and Location
• Full-time (40 hours per week), day shift from Monday to Friday
• On-site at Pratt and Whitney Longueuil and various client locations within the Greater Montreal
Salary and Benefits
• $29.00 to $45.00 per hour, based on experience
• Group insurance after 3 months of service
• ** Please note that only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Job Status:

Permanent

Full-time
Join our dynamic team and contribute to groundbreaking innovations #J-18808-Ljbffr

Entry Level Production Supervisor

Cintas is seeking a Production Supervisor to lead and direct our Production team. title: Production Team Leader
description:
Come join Nature's Touch and be part of a growing team!

Who we are:

Nature's Touch has established itself as a leader on the market for the distribution of frozen fruits and vegetables since 2004. We source from all over the world to secure a steady and reliable supply in order to bring the highest quality frozen fruits and vegetables to our customers at a competitive price and provide consumers with a consistent quality experience every time.

Why join us?

Come and grow your career by joining a dynamic team and participate in the growth of a leading company in its industry! We offer a competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package with drug, dental care, vision care, paramedical services, life insurance, etc. We also offer paid personal days in addition to the vacation time.

The Team Leader is responsible of managing two machine lines on each shift, for the strategic coordination of team members on the production line to achieve the desired level of efficiency. The Production Team Leader is not only a qualified Team Leader and is also an experienced machine operator capable of making independent decisions and solving problems in the absence of supervisors. Some other tasks include:

Responsibilities:
• You will report directly to the Production Supervisor. You will ensure the proper operation of the machines under your responsibility and that the final packaged products meet the required quality and production process standards.
• Direct and coordinate assigned group of employees to ensure that goals are met in a timely manner.
• Manage absenteeism and report any team issues to supervisors.
• Work directly with the Maintenance department and Quality Control department to address downtime or issues.
• Ensure that the equipment is ready to start production or that it is properly shut down and disassembled before washing.
• Replace the wrapping roll and feed film to the machine.
• Monitor parameters and speed then adjust for proper seal, gusset, and speed.
• Notify supervisors if there are any malfunctions with equipment that would require service technician intervention.
• Ensure that GMP and safe work standards are always followed and report any irregularities or deviations to the Supervisor.
• Ensures that equipment and work area are kept clean.
• Performs other related duties as required.
• Lift and unload cartons of raw material at the filling station.
• Examine raw materials to verify compliance with Quality Control standards.
• Ensure that safety and sanitation regulations are respected at all times.
• Assist with other general labour tasks related to production needs.

Requirements:
• Two or more years experience as a machine operator, ideally in a food processing plant.
• French and English (to serve our internal and external customers).
• Must be team oriented and able to work under pressure.
• Be able to manage a team in proper manners.
• Experience working on packaging machines in the food industry is a great asset.
• Able to work in a cold environment .
• Able to handle loads from 20lb to 40lb.
• Basic knowledge of GMP, HACCP and SQF environment.

If that wasn't enough, here are other reasons you should join us!
• Great work environment, friendly and dynamic teams.
• Discount on STM Opus monthly passes.
• Free on-site parking.
• Free coffee.
• Uniforms provided.
• Afternoon shift premium (NTE/PM shift only).

Job Posted by ApplicantPro

title: Digital Growth Marketing Manager
description:
Company information

Agari Kitchen Corporation is revolutionizing the way we cook with our patent-pending technology that combines 3D scanning, sensors, and AI to perfectly cook proteins and vegetables. With our product set to launch on Kickstarter in April 2025, we’re gearing up for an exciting journey — and we want you to be a part of it!

We’re looking for a passionate and creative marketer to join us as our very first marketing hire. In this role, you’ll have the unique opportunity to shape our brand from the ground up. You’ll drive our e-commerce strategy, launch innovative online advertising campaigns, build relationships with influencers, engage with our social media community, and develop compelling organic content that captures the imagination of our audience.

If you’re ready to bring fresh ideas, think outside the box, and make a real impact in a startup that's set to change the game in home cooking, we’d love to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities:
• Develop, manage, and optimize online advertising campaigns on Meta (Facebook, Instagram) and Google/YouTube to maximize reach, engagement, and conversion.
• Oversee e-commerce strategies and operations on platforms such as Shopify and Amazon, ensuring seamless user experiences and continuous growth in sales.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement digital marketing strategies that align with business objectives and brand guidelines.
• Identify, engage, and manage relationships with influencers and brand ambassadors to promote products/services and enhance brand visibility.
• Monitor and analyze social media channels, ensuring proactive engagement, trend spotting, and timely response to customer inquiries or feedback.
• Use data analytics tools to measure the effectiveness of digital campaigns and provide actionable insights to refine strategies and improve ROI.
• Stay updated with industry trends, algorithm changes, and emerging digital marketing tools and techniques to keep the brand at the forefront of digital innovation.
• Prepare regular reports on digital growth metrics and KPIs, presenting findings and recommendations to senior management.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or a related field.
• 3-5 years of experience in digital marketing, specifically with online advertising on Meta and Google/YouTube.
• Proven experience managing e-commerce platforms such as Shopify and Amazon.
• Strong experience in social media management and influencer outreach.
• Proficiency in using digital marketing and analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Meta Ads Manager, etc.).
• Excellent communication, analytical, and project management skills.
• Creative thinker with the ability to adapt to a fast-paced environment and work under pressure.

Preferred Skills:
• Experience with A/B testing and data-driven decision-making.
• Familiarity with SEO, SEM, and content marketing.
• Knowledge of emerging social media platforms and digital marketing trends.
• Certification in Google Ads or Meta Blueprint is a plus.
• Experience with Kickstarter and Indiegogo is a plus.

Please send your resume in English. Only successful candidates will be contacted.

Informations sur l’entreprise

Agari Kitchen Corporation révolutionne notre façon de cuisiner grâce à une technologie innovante brevetée qui combine la numérisation 3D, des capteurs et l’intelligence artificielle pour cuire à la perfection les protéines et les légumes. Avec un lancement prévu sur Kickstarter en avril 2025, nous entamons une aventure passionnante — et nous voulons que vous en fassiez partie !

Nous recherchons un(e) marketeur(se) passionné(e) et créatif(ve) pour nous rejoindre en tant que tout premier(e) membre de notre équipe marketing. Dans ce rôle, vous aurez l’opportunité unique de façonner notre marque dès le départ. Vous piloterez notre stratégie de commerce électronique, lancerez des campagnes publicitaires en ligne innovantes, construirez des relations avec des influenceurs, animerez notre communauté sur les réseaux sociaux et développerez du contenu organique captivant qui saura séduire notre audience.

Si vous êtes prêt(e) à apporter des idées nouvelles, à penser différemment et à avoir un impact réel au sein d’une startup qui promet de transformer la cuisine à domicile, nous serions ravis d’avoir de vos nouvelles !

Responsabilités clés

Développer, gérer et optimiser des campagnes publicitaires en ligne sur Meta (Facebook, Instagram) et Google/YouTube pour maximiser la portée, l’engagement et les conversions.

Superviser les stratégies et opérations de commerce électronique sur des plateformes telles que Shopify et Amazon, en garantissant une expérience utilisateur fluide et une croissance continue des ventes.

Collaborer avec des équipes transversales pour concevoir et mettre en œuvre des stratégies de marketing numérique alignées avec les objectifs commerciaux et les directives de la marque.

Identifier, engager et gérer des relations avec des influenceurs et des ambassadeurs de marque pour promouvoir les produits/services et renforcer la visibilité de la marque.

Surveiller et analyser les canaux de réseaux sociaux, assurer une interaction proactive, repérer les tendances et répondre rapidement aux questions ou aux commentaires des clients.

Utiliser des outils d’analyse de données pour mesurer l’efficacité des campagnes numériques et fournir des recommandations actionnables pour affiner les stratégies et améliorer le retour sur investissement (ROI).

Se tenir informé(e) des tendances du secteur, des changements d’algorithmes et des outils émergents de marketing numérique pour maintenir la marque à la pointe de l’innovation numérique.

Préparer des rapports réguliers sur les indicateurs de croissance numérique et les KPI, et présenter les résultats et recommandations à la direction.

Qualifications

Diplôme de licence en Marketing, Communication, Commerce ou dans un domaine connexe.

3 à 5 ans d’expérience en marketing numérique, notamment dans la publicité en ligne sur Meta et Google/YouTube.

Expérience avérée dans la gestion de plateformes de commerce électronique telles que Shopify et Amazon.

Solide expérience en gestion des réseaux sociaux et en collaboration avec des influenceurs.

Maîtrise des outils de marketing numérique et d’analyse (par ex. Google Analytics, Meta Ads Manager, etc.).

Excellentes compétences en communication, analyse et gestion de projet.

Esprit créatif avec une capacité d’adaptation dans un environnement dynamique et sous pression.

Compétences préférées

Expérience dans les tests A/B et la prise de décisions basée sur les données.

Connaissance du SEO, SEM et du marketing de contenu.

Familiarité avec les plateformes sociales émergentes et les tendances en marketing numérique.

Certification Google Ads ou Meta Blueprint est un atout.

Expérience avec Kickstarter et Indiegogo est un atout.

title: Specialist, Marketing & Events - Montreal, QC
description:
Requisition ID: 208040

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

This role helps bring strategy and organizational priorities to life by creating and coordinating marketing and communications content for a variety of mediums to ensure the firm is well represented. The successful candidate positively contributes to the team’s culture, goals and overall team effectiveness.

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:

Marketing/Events
• Help execute on the marketing plan, with a focus on supporting the Institutional Management Team and growing the institutional client base
• Manage JFL’s participation in conferences and sponsorships, including custom bilingual marketing materials as needed
• Manage activities to run high-quality JFL events, webinars and other client engagement activities, including coordinating guest speakers, venues, catering, registration process, etc.
• Activation of events through distribution teams and social media (LinkedIn)
• Coordinate hosts and guests at the corporate hockey loge in Montreal and other sports tickets across offices
• Manage merchandising/gifts for clients, welcome packages for new clients, etc.
• Assist with tracking marketing budget and provide KPI reporting for sponsorships and events

Website, digital marketing and content creation
• Responsible for website, ensuring content is up to date and optimized for brand look and feel
• Prepare postings and updates for the website in English and French
• Contribute to ideas for digital campaigns and promotions
• Help manage activities related to podcast production, including content, speakers, recording, editing, and promotion
• Manage rollout and maintenance of e-business cards
• Support planning, writing, editing, and distributing internal and external newsletters, ensuring timely and engaging content.

Other
• Propose and help manage internal events, including charitable events, to increase employee engagement that would contribute to a culture of inclusion, belonging and collaboration
• Support the team’s quarterly reporting deliverables, including preparing quarterly reporting for sub-advisory mandates and Alliance clients
• Assist with other projects as requested by manager

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We’d love to work with you if you have:
• Undergraduate degree in Marketing or Communications
• Excellent writing skills; bilingualism required
• 3-5 years of experience in a marketing coordinator or specialist role
• Creative, strong marketing acumen
• Experience in or knowledge of investments
• Knowledge of compliance regulations an asset
• Strong attention to detail
• Organized and autonomous in accomplishing tasks under responsibility
• Strong interpersonal skills that enable successful partnering
• Excellent knowledge of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Adobe suite
• Experience with CRM software and marketing automation tools.
• Strong digital marketing skills, including social media management and digital campaign execution

“Pursuant to a language needs assessment conducted by Scotiabank, the successful candidate will be required to be able to communicate in English and French as they will be required to work closely with other groups from head office who operate primarily in English, and they will serve and English-speaking clientele.

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets. Jarislowsky, Fraser Limited (“JFL”) is a wholly-owned subsidiary of The Bank of Nova Scotia (“Scotiabank”) and operates as a distinct business division. JFL manages the portfolios of pension funds, foundations and endowments, corporations and high-net-worth individuals in Canada and internationally.

title: Restaurant Manager
description:
Restaurant Manager - Annual salary of $60 000 Performance bonus program We are more than just your local restaurant. We are a collection of hardworking small-business owners. Did you know that from coast to coast, we serve delicious choices to more than 2.5 million people in over 1,400 locations every day, or that we have proudly helped more than 387,000 Canadian families with sick children through Ronald McDonald House Charities?

Our offer Working with us means that you will have the opportunity to earn and learn, flexibility, and a safe and inclusive work environment. What this means in practice is:
Access to education and skills development opportunities that take you further A total rewards package that includes discounts, incentives, and recognition perks Flexible hours/shifts that suit your needs A safe, respectful and inclusive workplace Bring your authentic self to work - welcoming people of every age, background, and culture - just like the guests who visit our restaurants every day The job Manager / Restaurant Manager :
The General Manager (GG) is responsible for the restaurant's sales growth and customer base profitability as well as ensuring the restaurant meets McDonald's high standards for quality, service and cleanliness. The General Manager models exemplary customer experience behaviors. The General Manager works with the Manager reporting to him to establish the restaurant's targets for growth and put in place a plan to achieve those targets.

The general manager does not work alone; he manages a team of department managers who hold specific responsibilities within the restaurant. This means supporting department managers in setting their personal targets, tracking their progress, and providing coaching and guidance to improve their department's results. By improving departmental results, we improve restaurant results. The General Manager is responsible for energizing team members and managers.

This includes hiring and training each manager to ensure a winning team is in place in the restaurant for the future. Performance measures :
Review restaurant newsletter to determine relevant annual performance measures. These measures are, but not limited to:
Growth in sales/number of customers Growth of peak periods General performance of the pastry and order terminals Effectiveness of customer number forecasts Restaurant profits Staffing levels (management team and team members) P.A.E.R. Brand Standards Visit Notes General SSC Notes Team turnover rate over 90 days and general turnover rate Development of members of the management team Integration of team members and follow-up after 60 days Management team turnover rate The candidate must have:
Experience, 2 years minimum in fast food. Sense of responsibility Must be customer focused Aim for excellence Have a positive attitude Must be reliable Have an excellent sense of leadership Having good communication skills Be motivating and energetic Prioritize teamwork
• Experience at McDonald's: is an asset. Additional

Benefits:

Full-time jobs with a flexible schedule that meets your needs; A competitive starting salary with regular salary increases based on performance;
Access to benefits, such as medical, dental and life insurance The chance to learn cutting-edge business skills through our world-class training and development programs;
Bonus program Reimbursement of mileage Cellular allowance Complete management training program Merits and recognition of service Discount program Free uniforms Your vibe and experience While previous experience working in food service or retail as a barista, server, sales associate, cashier, team member, or customer sales representative as a manager is always helpful and appreciated, what is most important is who you are.

You lead by example and are accountable. You have high expectations and consistently raise the bar for yourself and your team. When confronted with a situation, you can assess and problem-solve with confidence. You put people before profit, knowing that creating a positive culture leads to happier, more engaged staff who will deliver a better experience for your guests.

About us In 1954, an enterprising salesman named Ray Kroc discovered a small burger restaurant in California, and wrote the first page of McDonald's history. In 1967, the first McDonald's Canada opened in Richmond, B.C. and we've been growing with our communities and serving quality food at great a value ever since. Today, McDonald's Canada is proud to be one of the world's leading foodservice retailers, offering job opportunities at corporate-owned restaurants or restaurants owned by independent franchisees.

McDonald's Canada and Owner/Operators are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. Our workplaces have a long-standing policy of providing fair, equitable, and accessible opportunities for all employees and prospective employees. Accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

title: VP, Process Engineering
description:
Step into the world of SRTX ( srtxlabs.com ) – where technology innovation meets textiles like never before! Proudly standing as a beacon of accountability, certified as a B Corp, SRTX is best known for its first technology, Sheertex. Sheertex is a knit made from one of the world’s strongest polymers which makes it tough and durable. Named one of TIME’s Best Inventions, our customers get up to 50 more wears from our tights than average tights, meaning fewer disposable tights end up in landfills.

Our team is what sets us apart! We are a group of 250+ dedicated problem-solvers, driven by a common goal: making a real impact on the textile industry and the environment. Our factory and office share our headquarters, which helps drive cross-departmental collaboration and innovation. Every team member has the opportunity to leave a direct and lasting impact as we strive to become the leading company in better textiles.

The Vice President of Process Engineering will be responsible for leading all process engineering activities related to fiber and polymer processing within SRTX’s textile manufacturing operations. This role involves optimizing production processes, managing pilot lines, and ensuring successful scale-up of new products from R&D to full-scale production. The VP will collaborate with cross-functional teams to improve efficiency, product quality, and sustainability in fiber and polymer production, while driving continuous improvement initiatives.

This is a hands-on leadership role where you will shape the future of fiber and polymer processing at SRTX, managing pilot line operations and overseeing the transition of new products into full production. Please note this role is completely onsite.

Responsibilities

Strategic Leadership:
• Develop and implement the overall strategy for fiber and polymer processing, ensuring alignment with SRTX’s long-term manufacturing goals.
• Lead process engineering initiatives to optimize fiber and polymer production lines, focusing on improving yield, product quality, and sustainability.
• Identify and implement new technologies and innovations in fiber and polymer processing to maintain SRTX’s competitive edge.

Pilot Line Management & Product Scale-Up:
• Oversee the operation and management of pilot lines for fiber and polymer processing, ensuring efficient testing and development of new products.
• Collaborate with the R&D team to transition products from pilot-scale development to full-scale production, ensuring a seamless scale-up process.
• Ensure that all new products are developed with scalability in mind, with efficient processes for ramping up from pilot lines to mass production.

Process Optimization & Efficiency:
• Oversee the optimization of existing fiber and polymer manufacturing processes to improve throughput, reduce costs, and enhance product quality.
• Lead efforts to standardize and document best practices for fiber extrusion, polymer processing, and other critical processes.
• Collaborate with R&D, production, and quality teams to develop new formulations and processes that meet the changing demands of the industry.

Technology & Innovation:
• Drive the integration of advanced technologies such as automation, robotics, and data analytics into fiber and polymer processing to enhance operational performance.
• Research and implement cutting-edge solutions in polymer chemistry, fiber extrusion, and material processing to stay ahead of industry trends.
• Ensure that the manufacturing processes are scalable and adaptable to new fiber and polymer product lines.

Sustainability & Compliance:
• Lead initiatives focused on sustainable manufacturing practices, including waste reduction, energy efficiency, and environmentally friendly fiber and polymer processes.
• Ensure compliance with all relevant environmental, safety, and industry regulations governing fiber and polymer production.
• Champion SRTX’s sustainability goals by aligning process improvements with the company’s environmental objectives.

Team Leadership & Development:
• Build and lead a team of process engineers, providing mentorship, guidance, and technical expertise to drive high-performance results.
• Foster a culture of continuous improvement, encouraging innovation and development within the process engineering team.
• Ensure that the team stays up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in fiber and polymer processing.

Collaboration & Stakeholder Engagement:
• Work closely with the EVP of Technology and other senior leaders to ensure that process engineering initiatives are aligned with the company’s broader operational goals.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including production, quality, R&D, and automation, to ensure seamless process integration across all functions.
• Engage with external partners, suppliers, and industry experts to stay current on technological advancements and industry best practices.

Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in Chemical Engineering, Polymer Engineering, Materials Science, or a related field; Master’s degree or PhD preferred.
• 10-15 years of experience in fiber, polymer, or textile manufacturing, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership or process engineering role.
• Strong expertise in fiber extrusion, polymer processing, and advanced material manufacturing technologies.
• Proven track record of managing pilot lines and successfully scaling up new products from R&D to full production.
• Experience optimizing manufacturing processes and implementing new technologies in fiber or polymer production.
• Knowledge of sustainability practices in fiber and polymer manufacturing, including waste reduction and energy efficiency.
• Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to manage and develop a high-performing team.
• Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage complex projects and multiple stakeholders simultaneously.
• Familiarity with automation and data-driven process optimization is a plus.

What we offer:
• RRSP matching contribution
• Birthday day off
• Sheertex tights gift
• Employee perks program
• Parental leave
• PPE allowance
• Paid time off & sick leave
• Health & dental benefit insurance
• Access to Telemedicine services (Dialogue)
• Donation matching & volunteer time off
• Commute perks with Opus & Cie & bike program
• Learning & career growth opportunities
• Snacks, coffee, and a collaborative work environment!

We are excited to welcome a dynamic individual to join our team and contribute to our mission. If you possess the skills and experience outlined above, and thrive in a fast paced, ever changing environment, we encourage you to apply. Together, let's innovate, grow, and make a meaningful impact. Join us in shaping the future of SRTX!

Want to learn more about SRTX? Check out our career site for more information! https://www.srtxlabs.com/careers/careers

title: Analyste Financier Sénior (H/F)
description:
Linking Talents, cabinet de recrutement spécialisé intervenant au Québec notamment, recherche pour son client dans le domaine de la santé qui gère des cliniques à travers le Canada. La compagnie est basée à Montréal. Il recherche un Analyste Financier pour s’intégrer dans l’équipe de la comptabilité.

Sous la supervision du directeur financier, le/la titulaire du poste sera responsable des fonctions suivantes :

Responsabilités Principales

Information financière et comptabilité d’entreprise
• Préparer les états financiers et assister le directeur financier dans les processus de clôture comptable mensuelle et de fin d’exercice annuel.
• Effectuer efficacement les réconciliations de fin de mois.
• Collaborer avec les équipes internes pour simplifier et rationaliser les processus financiers.
• Assister le directeur financier dans la gestion du modèle de budgétisation de l’entreprise.
• Produire divers rapports internes et externes sur demande.
• Préparer des états financiers consolidés, des rapports de groupe et des documents pour soutenir les décisions d’investissement.
• Participer à la vérification annuelle des états financiers en collaboration avec l’équipe comptable.
• Servir de point de contact pour toutes les demandes concernant les fournisseurs.
• Contribuer à la surveillance des contrôles internes pour garantir la conformité réglementaire des politiques et procédures de l’entreprise.
• Développer et suivre la réalisation des indicateurs clés de performance (KPI).
• Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les autres départements pour améliorer l’efficacité et augmenter la productivité.
• Effectuer toutes autres tâches connexes au poste au besoin.

Planification et analyse financière
• Maintenir le budget et assister le directeur financier dans les analyses des tendances et des écarts.
• Travailler en étroite collaboration avec l’équipe financière du siège social pour élaborer des budgets, des prévisions et identifier des opportunités d’efficacité opérationnelle.

Qualifications
• Minimum 2 ans d’expérience avec le logiciel NetSuite (obligatoire).
• Baccalauréat en comptabilité.
• Titre CPA (un atout)
• Au moins 3 ans d’expérience en comptabilité dans un cabinet ou une entreprise reconnue.
• Solide expérience en analyse financière avec une capacité à manipuler des ensembles de données financières.
• Expérience en planification, analyse financière et budgétisation.
• Bilingue en français et en anglais, à l’écrit comme à l’oral.
• Une expérience dans l’intégration et la mise en œuvre de systèmes comptables (un atout).
• Une expérience dans le secteur de la santé est un atout.

Compétences Personnelles
• Preuve en résolution de problèmes et gestion du temps.
• Excellentes compétences interpersonnelles.
• Capacité avérée à établir des relations à tous les niveaux de l’organisation tout en travaillant de manière autonome avec un haut niveau de performance.
• Capacité à s’adapter à un environnement en constante évolution et à des délais serrés.
• Aptitude à prioriser, à gérer plusieurs tâches simultanément et à développer de solides relations interpersonnelles.

title: Senior Analyst, Natural Resources Investments
description: ABOUT US We’re one of Canada’s largest pension investment managers, with CAD$264.9 billion of net assets as of March 31, 2024. We invest funds for the pension plans of the federal public service, the Canadian Forces, the Royal Canadian Mounted Police and the Reserve Force. Headquartered in Ottawa, PSP Investments has its principal business office in Montréal and offices in New York, London and Hong Kong. Capturing and leading complex global investments requires us to work as one to seize valuable opportunities, in close collaboration with some of the world’s top companies. At PSP, you’ll join a team of motivated and engaged professionals, dedicated to propelling our organization further than ever before. EXPERIENCE THE EDGE At PSP, we encourage our employees to grow, forge powerful relationships, contribute and fuel inspired investment launchpads. We are committed to a culture that fosters collaboration and allows us to think beyond, in an interconnected way. We advocate for our employees to speak-up, learn, experiment, share, and be part of an inclusive work environment where diversity is embraced. ABOUT YOUR ROLE As a Senior Analyst, Natural Resources Investments, you’ll: Perform investment analysis and execute transactions Perform preliminary analysis of investment opportunities, meet with prospective partners and industry experts and prepare summary reports Perform in-depth due diligence of potential investments, identify key investment merits and risks, meet with management teams, review documentation and work in conjunction with partners and third-party consultants Build detailed financial models, including performing extensive sensitivity analyses, review of financial projections and valuation assumptions Participate in the preparation of investment recommendation memorandums for investment approval Participate in presentations to various committees as required Represent the NR Team across the Timber, Agriculture, Seafood and Investment Industries Active networking with industry experts, consultants, peers and industry players Attend conferences, organize meetings and keep up to date on industry trends Participate in building deal-flow and becoming a subject matter expert Actively Manage Investments Monitor financial and operating results Interact with management and operating partners Work alongside management teams of portfolio companies on specific projects to create value Note: This position requires travel. WHAT YOU’LL NEED University degree with strong academic standing Professional designation: CFA an asset Experience in private investments, investment banking, consulting, corporate finance, equity research or in a natural resources company considered a strong asset Superior level of proficiency with business software and analytical tools Strong financial skills, including experience in building financial models, and familiar with financial statements Project management skills and ability to meet tight deadlines Strong communication and presentation skills Mature, driven, motivated and ability to take initiative Responsible, diligent, and able to work independently and as part of a team Good attention to detail and presentation of information Good communications skills in English and French (or willingness to learn) *(Regular interactions in English with investment partners based outside of Quebec Example: peers, bankers, brokerage firms, etc. and PSP employees in our offices in Hong Kong, London and New York, and interactions in French with employees in our local offices in Montreal and Ottawa) We offer a tailored employee experience and competitive total rewards and benefits package* designed to attract and retain global diverse talent, reward performance, and reinforce business strategies and priorities. Beyond salary and incentive pay eligibility, you have access to: Investment in career development Comprehensive group insurance plans Competitive pension plans Unlimited access to virtual healthcare services and wellness programs Gender-inclusive paid family leave policy: up to 26 weeks for primary caregivers, 5 weeks for secondary caregivers A personalized family-building support, from pre-pregnancy to menopause, with available financial assistance Vacation days available on day one with additional days on milestone service anniversaries, and summer Friday afternoons off A hybrid work model with a mix of in-office and remote days *Benefits package may vary based on your employee type. At PSP, we aim to provide an inclusive workplace where we leverage diversity and where everyone feels valued, safe, respected and empowered to grow. As part of this leadership commitment, we strongly encourage applications from all qualified applicants and strive to offer an inclusive and accessible candidate experience. If you require any accommodation for any part of the recruitment process, please let us know. Visit us on www.investpsp.com/en/ Follow us on LinkedIn #LI-AM1 We’re one of Canada’s largest pension investment managers, with CAD$264.9 billion of net assets. We invest funds for the pension plans of the federal public service, the Canadian Forces, the Royal Canadian Mounted Police and the Reserve Force. We are committed to fostering an environment where experiences and learning opportunities provide you with the platform to grow. If you are having difficulty applying, you can reach us at careers@investpsp.ca

title: Senior Analyst Content Planning & Analysis
description:
At Fiera Capital We invest in creating a culture of purpose that makes our people feel valued, cared for, seen, and heard.
The teams work closely with Fiera’s product development and distribution teams to define and manage the product offerings ensuring that service delivery, operational risk, operational readiness, regulatory compliance, profitability, and scale is achieved in each product.
Under the supervision of the Supervisor, Financial Reporting, the Senior Analyst, Financial Reporting will be part of a team within a global organization focused on preparation of the financial statements and the management reports of fund performance (“MRFP”) of the Fiera funds. He will be exposed to a vast range of public and private funds with a multitude of strategies (fixed income, equity, alternative, etc.). In collaboration with members of his team, he will participate in the implementation of continuous improvement initiatives on processes and business procedures. Participate in the planning and production of financial statements and MRFP of the Fiera funds
Create draft versions of financial statements and MRFP using available content, templates and guidelines
Develop and write new content when needed
Proofread documents to ensure consistency of information and make corrections when needed
Perform validation checks including variance analysis to detect potential errors
Participate in various projects to optimize processes for Fiera funds
A Bachelor’s degree in accounting, business administration and/or related college degree with equivalent work experience required
Experience in fund administration / fund accounting (an asset)
• Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office
• Fluently bilingual (French and English) both written and spoken

Fiera Capital adheres to a hybrid working environment with 3 days in-office per week
For all positions in Quebec (Montreal and Laval), proficiency in French, both spoken and written, is mandatory. Working English proficiency is also required in order to serve our offices and clients around the world.
Our staff is our most valuable asset, and our goal is to create an inclusive and equitable environment where everyone can achieve their true potential.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, colour, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, or on the basis of disability, genetic information or any other federal, state, or local protected class. All staffing decisions, including hiring and promotion decisions, will be based on merit, skills, performance, and business needs. Job applicants who are individually selected for an interview will be notified that accommodations are available upon request. If a selected participant requests accommodation, Fiera Capital shall consult with the applicant and provide, or arrange for the provision of, suitable accommodation in a manner that considers the applicant’s accessibility needs due to disability.

title: Responsable de dossier - CPA
description:
Prosperia Comptabilité et Fiscalité Inc. est un cabinet comptable reconnu pour son expertise en matière de comptabilité et de fiscalité. Nous nous engageons à offrir des services de haute qualité à nos clients. Nous valorisons l’intégrité, l’innovation et l’excellence dans tout ce que nous entreprenons.

Responsabilités

· Gérer un portefeuille de clients et assurer un suivi régulier de leurs dossiers.

· Préparer et analyser les états financiers de type mission de compilation au mission d'examen.

· Préparer les déclarations fiscales des dossiers dont vous avez la responsabilité.

· Offrir des conseils en matière de comptabilité et de gestion financière.

· Collaborer avec les autres membres de l’équipe pour fournir un service client exceptionnel.

Qualifications

· Titre CPA requis.

· Minimum de 2 ans d’expérience dans un poste similaire en cabinet comptable.

title: Delivery Driver
description:
Nous recherchons un Livreur fiable et motivé pour rejoindre notre équipe. En tant que membre clé de notre service, vous veillerez à ce que nos clients reçoivent leurs commandes rapidement et en parfait état. Si vous êtes ponctuel, axé sur le service client, et aimez travailler de manière autonome, nous serions ravis de vous rencontrer !

Responsabilités
• Récupérer les commandes de nourriture dans notre restaurant et les livrer aux clients en temps voulu.
• Assurer la manipulation et la livraison des produits alimentaires en toute sécurité.
• Suivre les itinéraires et les horaires de livraison indiqués.
• Fournir un excellent service client avec une attitude positive.
• Communiquer efficacement avec l'équipe du restaurant pour toute mise à jour ou problème de commande.

Exigences
• Permis de conduire valide et dossier de conduite sans infractions.
• Véhicule fiable adapté aux livraisons.
• Capacité à travailler des horaires flexibles, y compris les soirées et les week-ends.
• Fort sens des responsabilités et de la ponctualité.
• La connaissance de la région locale est un atout.

Rejoignez-nous pour offrir un service de livraison exceptionnel et faire partie d'une équipe conviviale !

We are looking for a reliable and motivated Food Delivery Driver to join our team. As a key member of our service, you will ensure that our customers receive their orders promptly and in perfect condition. If you are punctual, customer-focused, and enjoy working independently, we’d love to hear from you!

Responsibilities
• Pick up food orders from our restaurant and deliver them to customers in a timely manner.
• Ensure food items are handled and delivered safely.
• Follow delivery routes and schedules as directed.
• Provide excellent customer service with a positive attitude.
• Communicate effectively with the restaurant team for any order updates or issues.

Requirements
• Valid driver’s license and clean driving record.
• Reliable vehicle suitable for deliveries.
• Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends.
• Strong sense of responsibility and punctuality.
• Familiarity with the local area is a plus.

Join us to provide exceptional food delivery service and be part of a friendly team!

Job Type: Part-time

Expected hours: 7 – 8 per week

Additional pay:
• Tips

Benefits:
• Store discount

Work Location: In person

Expected start date: 2024-11-15

description: Hello, my name is Stefan and I am looking for a hard-working housekeeper who will help me on a long-term basis and ideally already has experience in cleaning. Looking for someone to help me with Bed changing and Dish washing. Please send me a message to discuss this job in more detail.

title: Residential Housekeeping in West-Island of Montreal
description:
Brilliant Cleaning Services is seeking full and part-time house cleaning teams (individuals and/or teams of two) in the West-Island of Montreal area.

About Brilliant Cleaning Services

Brilliant Cleaning Services is a premier home cleaning company dedicated to delivering top-tier cleaning services across all the West-Island of Montreal and Vaudreuil-Soulages areas.

About the Role

We're on the lookout for skilled and professional domestic cleaning teams (individuals or teams of two) to join our team! We seek exceptional cleaners who take pride in their work, possess a keen eye for detail, and excel in organization and time management. Our compensation is outstanding - Earn between $20-25/hr + Tips + Bonuses as an independent contractor.

We uphold core values of Supportive, Trustworthy, Above and Beyond, and Reliable.

When you partner with Brilliant Cleaning Services, you'll have the flexibility to set your availability using our mobile app. Clock in and out right from your phone, allowing us to assign jobs based on your schedule. As you consistently deliver exceptional service, recurring customers will request you, enabling you to work with familiar faces.

Brilliant Cleaning Services does not supply equipment or insurance; however, we handle all aspects of advertising, scheduling, estimates, customer service, and billing, allowing you to focus solely on your work. This contractor role requires independent work.

Already have your clientele? No problem! We'll assist you in expanding your client base and provide as much work as desired. Have a partner you currently work with? Excellent! We'll ensure you're scheduled together for jobs.

Requirements:

- Minimum of 1 year of professional residential cleaning experience

- Must possess your own cleaning supplies and equipment

- Smartphone with internet access for scheduling and communication

- Legally authorized to work in Canada

- Reliable transportation

- Fluency in English; French proficiency is advantageous

- Ability to pass a criminal background check

Benefits:

- Flexible schedule

- Competitive pay $20/hr + Tips + Bonuses

- Opportunity for advancement and recurring clients

- Supportive team and company culture

How to Apply:

If you meet the requirements and are interested in joining our team at Brilliant Cleaning Services, please send your

resume and a brief cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you'd be a good fit for this position to

bookbrilliantcleaning@outlook.com. Please specify if you are applying as an individual cleaner or a cleaning team of two.

We eagerly anticipate hearing from you!

Services de Nettoyage Brillance est à la recherche d'équipes de nettoyage de maison à temps plein et à temps partiel (individuelles ou équipes de deux) dans le Secteur Vaudreuil-Soulanges.

À propos de Bright Cleaning Services

Brilliant Cleaning Services est une entreprise de nettoyage domestique de premier plan qui se consacre à fournir des services de nettoyage de haut niveau à travers toutes les banlieues de Vaudreuil-Soulages.

À propos du rôle

Nous sommes à la recherche d'équipes de nettoyage domestique compétentes et professionnelles (individuelles ou équipes de deux) pour rejoindre notre équipe !

Nous recherchons des nettoyeurs exceptionnels qui sont fiers de leur travail, possèdent un sens aigu du détail et excellent dans l'organisation et

gestion du temps. Notre rémunération est exceptionnelle - Gagnez entre 20$//h + Pourboires + Bonus en tant qu'indépendant prestataire.

Nous défendons les valeurs fondamentales de soutien, de confiance, d’excellence et de fiabilité.

Lorsque vous vous associez à Brilliant Cleaning Services, vous aurez la possibilité de définir votre disponibilité à l'aide de notre application mobile.

Pointez à l'arrivée et au départ directement depuis votre téléphone, ce qui nous permet d'attribuer des tâches en fonction de votre emploi du temps. Comme vous livrez constamment

un service exceptionnel, des clients récurrents vous solliciteront, vous permettant de travailler avec des visages familiers.

Brilliant Cleaning Services ne fournit ni équipement ni assurance ; cependant, nous nous occupons de tous les aspects de la publicité,

planification, estimations, service client et facturation, vous permettant de vous concentrer uniquement sur votre travail. Ce rôle d'entrepreneur nécessite un travail indépendant.

Vous avez déjà votre clientèle ? Aucun problème! Nous vous aiderons à élargir votre clientèle et vous fournirons autant de travail que possible.

Voulu

Avez-vous un partenaire avec lequel vous travaillez actuellement ? Excellent! Nous veillerons à ce que vous soyez programmés ensemble pour les travaux.

Exigences:

- Minimum d'un an d'expérience professionnelle en nettoyage résidentiel

- Doit posséder vos propres produits et équipements de nettoyage

- Smartphone avec accès Internet pour la planification et la communication

- Légalement autorisé à travailler au Canada

- Transport fiable

- Anglais courant; La maîtrise du français est un avantage

- Capacité à passer une vérification d'antécédents criminels

Avantages:

- Horaire flexible

- Salaire compétitif 20$/heure + Pourboires + Bonus

- Possibilité d'avancement et clients récurrents

- Équipe et culture d'entreprise solidaires

Comment s'inscrire:

Si vous répondez aux exigences et souhaitez rejoindre notre équipe chez Brilliant Cleaning Services, veuillez envoyer votre

CV et une brève lettre de motivation décrivant votre expérience pertinente et pourquoi vous seriez un bon candidat pour ce poste.

bookbrilliantcleaning@outlook.com. Veuillez préciser si vous postulez en tant que nettoyeur individuel ou en équipe de deux personnes.

Nous attendons avec impatience de vos nouvelles !

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $20.00-$22.50 per hour

Expected hours: 20 – 40 per week

Additional pay:
• Bonus pay
• Tips

Benefits:
• Casual dress
• Flexible schedule
• On-site parking

Flexible language requirement:
• French not required

Schedule:
• Day shift
• Monday to Friday
• Morning shift
• On call

Application question(s):
• Do you own a vehicle, and are willing to work in and around the West-Island of Montreal?
• Are you willing to obtain liability insurance?
• Are you able to provide your own cleaning supplies and equipment?

Experience:
• Cleaning: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:
• Driving Licence (required)

Work Location: On the road

title: Housekeeper help required
description:
Are you an experienced housekeeper with a passion for keeping homes tidy and organized? I'm looking for a dependable and detail-oriented individual to help me maintain my home in Montreal, Quebec. The ideal candidate will have experience in dishwashing, kitchen cleaning, and window washing. If you are reliable, responsible, and take pride in your work, I want to hear from you!

As a housekeeper in my home, you will be responsible for maintaining the cleanliness and tidiness of the kitchen, including washing dishes and sanitizing countertops. Additionally, I need help with window washing to keep my home looking bright and inviting. Attention to detail is essential, as I strive for a clean and welcoming living environment.

The hourly rate for this position is $17.0, and I am looking for someone who can work flexible hours. If you are interested in this opportunity, please message me with your experience and availability. I look forward to finding a reliable and hardworking housekeeper to help me maintain my home.

title: Housekeeper
description:
Are you a hardworking housekeeper looking for extra work? I, Thomas, am looking for a professional and experienced housekeeper to come to my home in Montreal, Quebec. I am offering a generous rate of $25.0 an hour for the right person.

Your duties include cleaning the bathroom, shampooing carpets, washing dishes, wiping down general rooms, cleaning the kitchen, washing windows, and wiping down the oven and fridge.

If you have the skills and experience to do all the above, plus a great eye for detail, I want to hear from you!

If you think you are up for the challenge, please don't hesitate to message me. I'm looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Services
• Bathroom
• Kitchen
• General Rooms
• Dishes
• Refrigerator Cleaning
• Oven Cleaning
• Carpet Shampooing
• Window Washing

title: Public Area Housekeeper
description:
Description

POSITION SUMMARY

Clean public and employee restrooms and showers. Clean glass in public and employee areas. Clean floor surfaces in public or employee space using designated chemicals, supplies, and equipment. Dust surfaces in assigned area. Empty trash containers, ashtrays, and ash urns in public areas into proper containers. Inspect condition of furniture for tears, rips, and stains and report damages. Clean and maintain lights. Post caution signs to limit traffic when necessary. Contact other departments directly for urgent repairs. Respond promptly to requests from guests and other departments. Identify and report preventative or other maintenance issues in public areas or guest rooms.

Follow all company and safety and security policies and procedures; report any maintenance problems, safety hazards, accidents, or injuries; complete safety training and certifications; properly store flammable materials. Ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional; maintain confidentiality of proprietary information. Welcome and acknowledge all guests according to company standards; anticipate and address guests’ service needs; assist individuals with disabilities; thank guests with genuine appreciation. Speak with others using clear and professional language. Support team to reach common goals. Ensure adherence to quality expectations and standards. Move, lift, carry, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 55 pounds without assistance and in excess of 55 pounds with assistance. Ability to push and pull work-related machinery over sloping and uneven surfaces. Reach overhead and below the knees, including bending, twisting, pulling, and stooping. Visually inspect tools, equipment, or machines (e.g., to identify defects). Grasp, turn, and manipulate objects of varying size and weight, requiring fine motor skills and hand-eye coordination. Move through narrow, confined, or elevated spaces. Move up and down a ladder. Stand, sit, kneel, or walk for an extended period across an entire work shift. Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisors.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATION

Education: No high school diploma or G.E.D. equivalent.

Related Work Experience: No related work experience.

Supervisory Experience: No supervisory experience.

License or Certification: None

Marriott International is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive, people-first culture. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, such as disability and veteran status, or any other basis covered under applicable law.

Notification to Applicants: Delta Hotels Montreal takes seriously its obligations under the applicable provincial legislation and will provide accommodations to job applicants needing assistance. If you require an accommodation in relation to this job posting, our online application or an interview, please call 905-366-5227 or email and a member of our Human Resources team will respond to your request. Please note that this phone number and email are only for those individuals who would like to request an accessibility accommodation as part of the recruiting process.

title: TN visa Opportunities for Registered Nurses – Relocate to the USA
description:
Leading international nurse recruiting agency, Conexus MedStaff, is hiring registered nurses who want to build an exciting new life in the United States and are eligible for a TN visa. Unlock a rewarding career and professional growth in the U.S. through high-paying assignments in New Jersey, Maryland and Georgia.

As an international nurse on TN visa sponsorship with Conexus, you’ll enjoy a short contract term, competitive pay and bonuses, personalized career development pathways, access to our award-winning Conexus Academy for professional growth opportunities, and comprehensive benefits – including medical and dental insurance, life insurance and more.

Join us today to grow your career and build a life you love in the U.S.

Your benefits

As a TN registered nurse working with Conexus, you will receive:
• 12-month Employment Agreement, with the option to extend
• Full TN visa sponsorship with no fees
• Competitive pay package with salary starting at $35 per hour
• $4,000 bonus
• $1,000 relocation bonus
• Referral bonuses for any successful referrals to Conexus MedStaff
• Assignment options in New Jersey, Maryland and Georgia
• Medical, dental and vision insurance
• Life insurance
• Paid Time Off (PTO)
• 401k retirement plan with employer match
• Award-winning clinical education program
• Free continuing education units (CEUs)
• English language education, to help you prepare for your English Proficiency Exam if applicable
• Licensure and credentialing reimbursement
• Full support from our team of experts at every stage of your journey

Our requirements
• Experience: Currently working with a minimum of 12 months experience in an inpatient role, in a hospital setting
• Specialities: MedSurg, Telemetry, PCU, Stepdown, ICU/SICU/MICU/CCU, OR, ER, Labor and Delivery
• Education: Graduated from an accredited school of nursing
• Passed the NCLEX

Apply now and take the first step towards a rewarding career and fulfilling future in the U.S.

Job Type: Contract
Contract length: 12 months

Benefits:
• Life insurance

Work Location: In person
